MsgJp:
数多の諸侯とは一線を画し
時には王に直接意見することも許されている
MsgEn:
Standing apart from the numerous lords,
the High Scepter enjoys the unique privilege
of directly advising the King.

MsgJp:
そして、そんな特別な立場を
確固たるものとしているのが
ハイセプターの操る“秘術”
敵の生命力を我が物とする戦闘術さ
MsgEn:
And what defines their special position?
The "mystic arts" wielded by the High Scepter.
A combat technique that seizes the life force
of the enemy as their own.

MsgJp:
――なにやら興味がありそうな素振りだね
残念ながら、ハイセプターの秘術は
一子相伝ってやつなのさ
MsgEn:
Seems like you're interested.
Unfortunately, the secret techniques
of the High Scepter are only passed down
in a lineage of one master to one apprentice.

MsgJp:
何も実の子供に伝えるわけじゃないけど――
君はどう転んだって、今後アッカー家のためだけに
尽くしていくような人間じゃないだろう？
弟子として取るにも不合格だね
MsgEn:
It's not like I'm passing it down
to my own child, but—
you're not the kind of person who,
no matter how you turn out, is going to serve
House Acre from now on, won't you?
You're not even fit to be a good apprentice.

MsgJp:
――――あれ？
おかしなことがあるものだな
君はどうやらハイセプターとしての
一歩を踏み出しているようだ
MsgEn:
---- Huh?
That's strange, indeed.
Seems like you're taking strides
towards becoming a High Scepter.

MsgJp:
技巧は置いておいて
敵を“引っ掻いて”魔力を引きずり出し
己の力とする――という基礎はわかってるんだね
MsgEn:
Putting technique aside,
You understand the basics:
to "mark" the enemy,
draw out their magick and make it your own.

MsgJp:
さて――当代のハイセプターたる私は
君に教えを授けた覚えはない――
となれば、未来もしくは過去のハイセプターが
君のことを気に入ったのかな？
MsgEn:
Now then, as the current High Scepter,
I hold no recollection
of imparting any teachings to you.
So I wonder if a High Scepter
from the very future or past
has taken a liking to you?

MsgJp:
まぁ、アッカー王家とハイセプターの関係も
今後どうなるのかはわからない――
ネド王子はハイセプターの助けを
必要としないかもしれないからね
MsgEn:
Well, I don't know what will happen
with the relationship
between the Acre Royal Family
and the High Scepter in the future. 
Prince Nedo may not even need the High Scepter.

MsgJp: よかったら、君の修練を見てあげようか？
MsgEn: If you'd like, shall I observe your training?

MsgJp:
君を未来のハイセプターと任ずるつもりはないが
まぁ、歴史上一人くらいは例外がいてもよかろうよ
万が一の時は、君がこの世で最後のハイセプターだ
ハハハ――
MsgEn:
While I have no intention of appointing you
as the future High Scepter, 
I suppose there could be an exception or two
throughout history.
After all, should the unthinkable happen
and you become the last High Scepter...
Well, that'd be quite a tale to tell.
Hahaha...

MsgJp:
君の気概は認めるが
どうにも気持ちが先走ってるみたいだね？
ある程度は基礎をものにしないと
この先どうにもならないよ
MsgEn:
I commend your enthusiasm,
but I fear you're getting ahead of yourself.
Without a solid foundation in the fundamentals,
you'll face insurmountable obstacles in your path.

MsgJp:
目安としては――
そうだな、ＬＶ．18になった頃に
また来るといい
それまではひたすら練習あるのみだ
MsgEn:
As a guideline, hmm,
it would be good to come back around level 18.
Until then, it's just all about practicing well.

MsgJp:
おっと、予想以上に頑張ってきたみたいだな
これには私も応えなければね
ふふ、なんだか嬉しいよ
MsgEn:
Well now, looks like you've been working
harder than I had expected.
I'll have to respond to that too.
Hehe, that somehow makes me happy.

MsgJp:
――ただし、義理は通してこなければ
君の修練周りを管理している人がいるんだろう？
その人にきちんと挨拶しておいで
MsgEn:
However, you must honor your obligations.
There's someone managing your training, right?
Go and inform them properly.

MsgJp: スキル課題解放おめでとう
MsgEn: Congratulations!

MsgJp:
ふぅん――なかなかいいんじゃないかい？
正直、ここまで来るとは思ってなかったけど
君になら、もう少し高度な技を教えてみても
いいかもしれないな
MsgEn:
Hmmm, that's pretty good, isn't it?
To be honest, 
I didn't think you'd make it this far,
but I might be willing to teach you
some more advanced tricks.

MsgJp:
なるほどね――
ずいぶんと力がついたじゃないか
君がアッカー王家に仕える者でないことが
惜しいくらいだ
MsgEn:
I see, hmm...
You've gained quite a lot of power, haven't you?
It's a shame that you do not serve
the Acre Royal Family.

MsgJp:
今からでも遅くない、ネド王子に仕える
ハイセプターとしてアッカーシェランに
永住してみないか？
MsgEn:
It's not too late even now.
Why don't you come and live in Acre Selund,
as Prince Nedo's High Scepter?

MsgJp:
絶対に損はさせない――
慣れぬ国での諸々の不都合からは
私が君を守り抜いてみせよう
大切に育てるよ、約束する――
MsgEn:
Rest assured, I vow to never let you down.
In this unfamiliar land,
I'll be your reliable shield.
I shall nurture you with utmost care,
I swear with fealty, this promise--

MsgJp:
――なんてね、ダメか
君だって覚者なんだもんなぁ
MsgEn:
... Just kidding.
I was sure that wouldn't work.
You're an Arisen too, after all.

MsgJp:
はぁ――よし、それじゃ
もっと実践的な技を教えてあげようじゃないか！
MsgEn:
Haah... Alright then.
Let me teach you some more practical skills!

MsgJp:
ハイセプターとは
王に仕え、王を支え、助言し、護る
そんな唯一の存在だ
MsgEn:
The High Scepter is a unique existence.
They serve their master by supporting them,
offering advice, and protecting them.

MsgJp:
しかして、近付きすぎることはなく
諸侯を差し置いて
王に直接意見することすら許される
MsgEn:
And yet, without ever overstepping the bounds,
one is permitted to bypass the nobles
and offer counsel directly to Royalty.

MsgJp:
歴史の中で編み出された秘術を用いる
国内唯一の存在――
そして、ただ一人の王に仕える存在
それがハイセプターだ
MsgEn:
Using the secret arts woven throughout history,
being the sole existence within the country—
And the one who serves only one master.
That is the High Scepter.

MsgJp:
まぁ、ね
異国から来た君にとっては
この辺りのことは関係ないことかもしれない
MsgEn:
Well, I suppose that all of this
might be irrelevant to you,
coming from a foreign land.

MsgJp:
ただの戦闘術ではないのだという
誇りみたいなものを伝えたくて
こんな話をしてしまった
MsgEn:
It's not just a simple combat technique.
I wanted to convey something like pride,
so I ended up telling this story.

MsgJp:
おかえりなさいませ、覚者さま
任地でのお働きぶり、神殿にまで届いております
MsgEn:
Welcome back, Master Arisen.
Your diligent work in the field
has reached even the Temple.

MsgJp:
この《白竜神殿レーゼ》にはご存知の通り
白竜さまがおわす《謁見の間》、中央広場、
商店区、宿場区、港洞がございます
MsgEn:
As you know,
within the White Dragon Temple of Lestania,
there resides the Audience Chamber
where the White Dragon dwells,
the Central Square, the Shopping District,
the Relay Station District, and the Cave Harbor.

MsgJp:
どうぞ、各区にて次なる任務への
ご準備をなさってください
MsgEn:
Please prepare for the next mission 
in each district.

MsgJp:
達成された任務、クエストがございましたら
《保管ボックス》の確認をお忘れなく
そちらから、報酬をお受け取りください
MsgEn:
If you have completed any tasks or quests,
don't forget to check your "Storage Box"
to receive your rewards!

MsgJp:
また、入手されたアイテムや素材で
アイテムバッグがいっぱいの時も
そちらにて、所持品整理をなさってください
MsgEn:
Also, when your Item Bag has been filled
with various items and materials,
please organize your belongings there.

MsgJp: はい、何かご用でしょうか？
MsgEn: Yes, do you have any business here?

MsgJp:
この辺りは長く人の立ち入らぬ禁域
覚者さまといえど、油断なさいませんよう――
MsgEn:
This area is a forbidden wasteland
where people seldom tread.
Even as an esteemed Arisen,
please do not let your guard down.

MsgJp:
探索は順調でございますか？
何らかの手掛かりや休養が必要でしたら
標の祠にお立ち寄りくださいませ
MsgEn:
Is your exploration going smoothly?
If you need any clues or rest,
please stop by at the shrine.

MsgJp:
私は神殿よりの密命を受け
ひそかにこの地を見守っている者
しかしこのところの変化は、ここより
さらに遠く――別の地から来ているようです
MsgEn:
I have received a secret mission from the temple,
to silently watch over this land.
However, the recent changes
seem to be coming from a place even further away
- a different land entirely.

MsgJp: 覚者さま、何ご用でしょうか？
MsgEn: Master Arisen, what brings you here?

MsgJp:
覚者様の鼓動は、白竜様が預かっておいでです
あなた様が力尽きた時も、《復活力》の加護が
働けば、再び立ち上がることができるでしょう
MsgEn:
The heartbeat of the Arisen
the Lord White Dragon holds in his care.
Even when your strength falters,
with the divine protection of "Revival Power,"
you shall rise again, forevermore.

MsgJp:
白竜様から《復活力》の加護を受けられるのは
1度に3回分まで――
どうぞご留意ください
MsgEn:
You can receive the Divine Protection
of the Lord White Dragon's "Revival Power"
three times, once daily.
Please note this well.

MsgJp:
白竜様、この方に《復活力》のご加護を――
あなたの覚者が、三たび倒れども
立ち上がることができますよう――
MsgEn:
Lord White Dragon,
may you bestow your Divine Protection
of "Revival Power" upon this individual--
so that if your Arisen should fall
even thrice in time to misfortune
that they stand with vigor once more.

MsgJp:
あら、あなたは既に本日《復活力》の加護を
受けられたご様子
加護を受けられるのは日に１度です
どうかご留意ください
MsgEn:
Oh, it seems you have already received
the Divine Protection of "Revival Power" today.
Please note that you can only receive
this protection once a day.

MsgJp:
あら？　あなたは既に《復活力》の加護で
満たされていますね
MsgEn:
Oh?
You are already blessed
with the Divine Protection of "Revival Power."

MsgJp:
覚者さま、加護を失った時にお訪ねください
どうか良き旅を
MsgEn:
Arisen, do revisit me
when you have lost your blessings.
May you have a safe journey.

MsgJp:
あら、覚者様はまだ《復活力》の加護に
守られておいでですね
残っている復活力を捨て、新たな復活力を
授かりますか？
MsgEn:
Oh, Arisen, you are still under
the Divine Protection of "Revival Power."
Will you discard the remaining revivals
and receive a new set?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
では、今日も覚者様に白竜様のご加護が
あらんことを――
MsgEn:
May the Divine Protection of the White Dragon
be with you, Arisen, today as well...

MsgJp:
覚者様へ本日分の
任証スタンプと支給品を預かっております
どうぞお受け取りください
MsgEn:
Esteemed Arisen,
I have today's stamp and supplies for you.
Please accept them.

MsgJp:
あら、すでに覚者様は本日の
任証スタンプと支給品を
受け取っていらっしゃいますね
どうぞよき旅を
MsgEn:
Oh, it seems that the esteemed Arisen
has already received today's stamp and supplies.
Be well, and have a pleasant journey.

MsgJp:
おめでとうございます、覚者様！
日頃のご活躍に対し、あなた様に特別な
任証スタンプと支給品が届いています
MsgEn:
Congratulations, Master Arisen!
For your daily achievements,
a special stamp and some supplies
have been delivered to you.

MsgJp:
どうぞ、お受け取りください
あなたの旅に白竜様の祝福がありますよう
MsgEn:
Please, take it.
May you have the blessings
of the Lord White Dragon on your journey.

MsgJp:
私は、白竜様より覚者様がたに
《復活力》の加護を渡す役目を
申しつけられております
MsgEn:
I have been entrusted by the Lord White Dragon
to bestow "Revival Power" to the Arisen.

MsgJp: 覚者様に、白竜様の加護があらんことを――
MsgEn:
May the Divine Protection of the White Dragon 
be with you, Ser Arisen.

MsgJp: この日があるのも白竜様のお陰ね
MsgEn: This day exists thanks to the Lord White Dragon.

MsgJp: いいお日和ね
MsgEn: 'Tis a fine day.

MsgJp: 調子はいかが？
MsgEn: How do you fare?

MsgJp: こんにちは
MsgEn: Greetings.

MsgJp:
覚者ってどんなところがスゴイの？
俺よくわかんねぇんだよな～
――あ、説明しないで
あんま聞く気ないんだわ
MsgEn:
What makes the Arisen so amazing?
I really don't understand.
--Oh, don't bother explaining.
I have no interest in hearing it.

MsgJp:
マリサと俺ってば運命で結ばれてっから
誰にも引き裂けないぜ
MsgEn:
Marisa and I are bound by fate
and no one can tear us apart.

MsgJp:
俺、本気で働いたら
ぜってー金持ちになると思うんだよな～！
結構そういう才能あるからさぁ
――ま、その気になればだけど
MsgEn:
If I really put in the effort and worked hard,
I think I could become rich, you know~!
I have quite a talent for that kind of thing.
Well, if I really set my mind to it, that is.

MsgJp: ん？　何か用？
MsgEn: Hmm?　What do you want?

MsgJp:
覚者さんにゃ
常日頃から世話になってるね
MsgEn:
Esteemed Arisen,
I am truly grateful
for your constant care and assistance.

MsgJp: まぁ必要なものがあれば買ってってくれ
MsgEn:
Well, if there's aught you require,
I'll gladly sell it to you.

MsgJp:
アクセサリーはつけているかい？
おっと、お洒落の話だけじゃないよ
MsgEn:
Do you have any accessories on? 
Oh, sorry, it's not just about fashion.

MsgJp:
指輪やピアスを身に付ければ
心身にもいい影響がある
興味があれば見ていってくれ
MsgEn:
Wearing rings and earrings,
can have a positive impact on your mind and body.
Take a look, if you like.

MsgJp:
この神殿は人も物も集まるな
とくに重大任務が発布される時は
俺達商人にとっちゃ、かきいれ時さ
MsgEn:
This temple attracts both people and goods.
Doubly so when a major mission is announced,
it's a great time for us merchants!

MsgJp:
おお、いらっしゃい！
ぜひ見ていってくれ
役に立つ商品を揃えているつもりだよ
MsgEn:
Oh, welcome!
Take a gander, Ser.
I'm sure you'll find aught of use.

MsgJp:
珍しい物をお持ちでしたら
相応の逸品と交換してさしあげますよ？
――へっへへ
MsgEn:
If you have any rare items,
I will gladly exchange them for worthy treasures.
--Hehehe.

MsgJp:
覚者さんは、世界のあちこちを旅されているとか
では、見聞が広い分、相当に貴重な品や武具も
お持ちなんでしょうなぁ――いやはや
MsgEn:
Ser Arisen,
I heard that you've traveled all over the world.
With such a broad range of experiences,
I imagine you must possess
quite some valuable items and equipment.
Oh my, how impressive!

MsgJp:
わたしはね、自分が扱う品には絶対の自信を
持っておりましてね――
鑑定交換に足る品をお持ちでしたら、ぜひお声掛けを
MsgEn:
I have absolute confidence in the items I handle.
If you have anything worth appraising, 
please let me know.

MsgJp:
へっへへ――
希少品、珍品の鑑定交換でしたらお任せを
MsgEn:
Hehehe――
If it's an exchange for rare and unique items, 
leave it to me.

MsgJp:
わたしは、《鑑定交換》を生業とする
グレゴリーと申す者――
へっへへ、しがない商人でございますよ
MsgEn:
I am Gregory, a merchant who specializes in 
'Appraisal and Exchange'.
A humble tradesman, if you will.
Hehehe--

MsgJp:
ええまぁしかし――
わたしが扱い、交換に応じるのは
希少品、珍品、もしくは興味を引かれた逸品のみ！
MsgEn:
Well, rather,
I only deal in rare items, unique treasures,
or items that pique my interest!

MsgJp:
もしこのリストにある品をお持ちでしたら
それに相応しき価値ある品と
鑑定交換してさしあげましょう
MsgEn:
If you have an item on this list,
we will be happy to exchange it
for an item of commensurate value.

MsgJp:
ささ、いかがですかな？
――覚者様
MsgEn:
Well, what do you think?
――Ser Arisen.

MsgJp:
さてさて――ここに腰を落ち着けるか否か――
どんな方々に何を持ってきていただけるかで
へっへへ、考えるとしますかねぇ
MsgEn:
Well, well—
whether to settle down here or not—
depends kind of things come around.
Hehehe, I'll have to think about it.

MsgJp: あまり無理はするなよ
MsgEn: Don't push yourself too hard.

MsgJp: 冒険は順調か？
MsgEn: Is your adventure going well?

MsgJp: 調子はどうだ？
MsgEn: Faring well, I hope?

MsgJp: ああ、何か用か？
MsgEn: Aye, what can I do you for?

MsgJp: あまり無理はするなよ
MsgEn: Don't push yourself too hard.

MsgJp: ああ、何か用か？
MsgEn: Aye, what can I do you for?

MsgJp: 冒険は順調か？
MsgEn: Is your adventure going well?

MsgJp: 調子はどうだ？
MsgEn: Faring well, I hope?

MsgJp: あら、こんにちは覚者さん
MsgEn: Ah, well met, ser.

MsgJp:
うちで扱ってる食材は酒場の
メニューにもなってるんです
MsgEn:
The ingredients we handle
are also featured on the menu at the tavern.

MsgJp: おいしい物を食べれば元気がでますよ！
MsgEn: Eating delicious food will energize you!

MsgJp:
体力をつけたい時はお肉
スタミナが足りない時はキノコ
体調を整えたければハーブ
MsgEn:
When you want to build up your health, eat meat.
When you're lacking stamina, eat mushrooms.
If you want to balance your condition, use herbs.

MsgJp:
お肉、キノコ、それに飲み物やハーブ――
食材にはそれぞれ違った味わいがあって
体への影響も違うんです
MsgEn:
Meat, mushrooms, and even drinks and herbs—
Each ingredient has a different flavor
and also affects the body differently.

MsgJp: 偏食しちゃダメですよ！
MsgEn: You mustn't be a picky eater!

MsgJp:
ポーン達もクラフトルームでは
お料理するという話ですね
MsgEn: I hear that the Pawns also cook in the craft room.

MsgJp:
一流の料理レシピのいくつかは
彼らが作ったとも言われているんです
MsgEn:
Some of the finest cuisine recipes are said
to have been created by them.

MsgJp:
最近は関所の取り締まりも厳しくなって
地方の方は大変だと聞きました
MsgEn:
Recently, I heard that the enforcement at the 
checkpoints has become stricter, 
making it difficult for people in the rural areas.

MsgJp:
確かに、以前よりうちに仕入れにくる
商人の方も随分減った気がします
MsgEn:
Certainly, it does feel like
there are significantly fewer merchants
coming to our shop to purchase goods,
as compared to before.

MsgJp:
手塩にかけて育てたっていうのに
あの子ったらちっとも言うこと聞かないで――
MsgEn:
Even though I raised him with such care,
that child never listens to a word I say...

MsgJp:
あ、息子のことなんだけどね
もういい年なのにいつまでも落ち着かないんだよ
MsgEn:
Oh, it's about my son.
Even though he's already of age,
he just can't seem to settle down.

MsgJp:
うちの息子は無鉄砲なんだけど
運が強いのか、不思議なことに
何をやっても無事なんだよね
はぁ、でもその運もいつまでもつのやら――
MsgEn:
My son is reckless, but strangely enough,
he manages to come out unscathed
no matter what he does.
Haah, I wonder how long his luck will last...

MsgJp:
若い頃って、ああいう女が
よく見えるものなのかねぇ――
いや、息子の話なんだけど、困ったもんで
MsgEn:
I wonder if it's because when you're young,
women like that tend to catch your eye.
Hmm... No, it's about my son,
but it's quite troublesome.

MsgJp: はぁ、心配ごとって尽きないわね――
MsgEn: Oh, the worries are endless...

MsgJp:
何事も楽しまないと損！
それから、楽しませないと損よ！
MsgEn:
Don't miss out on enjoying everything!
And don't let it pass without making it enjoyable!

MsgJp:
さぁ、今回もお祭りを楽しんじゃいましょ！
美味しいお菓子を集めて、交換して、食べる！
MsgEn:
Now, let's enjoy the festival again!
Gather delicious sweets,
exchange them, and eat!

MsgJp:
去年のキャンディとクッキーに負けず劣らず
今年のお菓子もキュートでおいしくて素敵なの！
MsgEn:
Not to be outdone by last year's candy and cookies
this year's candy is cute, delicious & wonderful!

MsgJp:
そういえば、ハロウィンのお祭りって
みんな思い思いの仮装をしがちでしょ？
MsgEn:
Come to think of it, Halloween festivities
let everyone dress up as they wish, right?

MsgJp:
もしかしたら、魔物の仮装をした人が
実は本物の魔物だったりして――
ふふ、冗談冗談！
MsgEn:
Perhaps, the person dressed as a monster
is actually a real demon――
Hehe, just kidding!

MsgJp:
こんにちは～！
調子はどう？
MsgEn:
Hello~!
How are you doing?

MsgEn: This day exists thanks to the Lord White Dragon.

MsgJp: いいお日和ね
MsgEn: 'Tis a fine day.

MsgJp: 調子はいかが？
MsgEn: How do you fare?

MsgJp:
ふふん、どうだね？
この衣装も、まさにこの日のために用意していたのだ
コレクション用にと思っていた女物の方は
シェリーちゃんに奪われてしまったが――
MsgEn:
Hehee, what do you think?
I had this outfit prepared just for this occasion.
The women's version, which I had been thinking
of keeping for my collection,
was snatched away by Sherry though...

MsgJp:
あっ、いや、シェリーちゃんは
俺のラッキーパワフルエンジェルだとも！
とってもよくお似合いだなぁ！
――キミもそう思うだろう！？
MsgEn:
Ah, no, 
Shelly is also my Lucky Powerful Angel! 
It suits her very well, doesn't it!
You must think so too, right?!

MsgJp:
こういう季節の楽しみを
心から満喫する毎日は楽しいッ！
終わっても思い出で楽しいッ！
MsgEn:
Enjoying the pleasures of this season
to the fullest makes every day enjoyable!
Even after it's over, the memories are joyful!

MsgJp:
だからこそ、この日のためにだな
こそこそと準備を重ねてきたわけだよ
実は準備中もそれなりに楽しかったんだがね！
MsgEn:
That is why, for the sake of this day,
we have been quietly preparing all along.
To be honest, I actually had quite a bit of fun
during the preparations!

MsgJp:
俺こそはレスタニアのお祭り男
その名もアンジェロ！
MsgEn:
I am the festive man of Lestania.
My name is Angelo!

MsgJp:
今こそ俺が輝く時――！
限られたこの期間のために
ずっと準備してきていたんだからなッ！
そう、息を潜めてひっそりこっそりと――
MsgEn:
Now is the time for me to shine!
I've been preparing for this limited time!
Yes, quietly and secretly...

MsgEn: Hey there! How are you doing!

――君にはまだナイショだ
MsgEn:
Hehehe, I've just come up
with something really interesting.
To you, it's a secret, though.

MsgJp:
君には広い自室があっていいね
僕ならあれだけのスペースがあれば
部屋の半分を温室にするかな
MsgEn:
It's nice that you have a spacious room.
If it were me, with that much space,
I would turn half of the room into a greenhouse.

MsgJp:
《マンドラゴラ》――
あのキュートで不思議な存在に
もう僕は首ったけだよ
MsgEn:
Mandragora--
That cute and mysterious little thing,
it has fully captivated me.

部屋の改装なんかの相談は
いつでも歓迎よ！
MsgEn:
You are always welcome to contact me
to discuss room renovations and the like!

MsgJp: 新しい家具、私も探してみようかな
MsgEn: I wonder if I should also look for new furniture.

MsgJp:
《マイルーム（仮）》は、覚者さまだけの
プライベート空間よ！
MsgEn:
《My Room (temporary) 》
is your very own private space, Master Arisen!

MsgJp:
ポーンとゆっくり過ごして日頃の疲れを
取っていってね
MsgEn:
Spend time with your Pawn
and rest away your daily fatigue!

MsgJp: 《マイルーム》のことなら何でも相談してね！
MsgEn: Feel free to ask me anything about "My Room"!

MsgJp:
ルキーノと一緒にいると面白いよ
何か、そういうさぁ、面白いことを
見つけるパワーがあるっていうか――
MsgEn:
Being with Luchino is always entertaining.
He has a certain, you know,
knack for finding interesting things—

MsgJp:
ルキーノのママって超心配性なの
人生は限りがあるってのに
悩んでる時間ってムダヅカイよね～
MsgEn:
Luchino's mom is super overprotective, isn't she?
Our lives are finite,
worrying is a waste of time, you know~

MsgJp:
ねぇねぇ、何か面白いことがあったら
あたしにも教えてよね
MsgEn:
Hey, hey, if you find anything interesting,
let me know too!

MsgJp: 元気ィ？
MsgEn: How are you?

MsgJp: 覚者様、お部屋のインテリアを変えてみませんか？
MsgEn: Arisen, would you like to change up your room?

MsgJp:
アチーブメントを達成すると
《家具レシピ》を入手できます
それを元に、ポーンにクラフトで作ってもらうんです
MsgEn:
When you complete an achievement,
you'll get a《Furniture Recipe》
and have your Pawn craft it for you!

MsgJp:
覚者様とポーンが協力して作り上げるお部屋――
きっと素敵なお部屋になるんでしょうね！
MsgEn:
The room that Ser Arisen and Pawn
are working together to create--
I'm sure it will be a beautiful room!

MsgJp:
覚者様のお部屋がどんな風に変わるのか
楽しみにしてます！
MsgEn:
I'm looking forward to seeing how the room
of the esteemed Arisen will change!

MsgJp:
《覚者の自室》は、貴方だけの
プライベート空間です！
MsgEn: The "Arisen's Room" is your own private space!

MsgJp:
パートナーポーンとゆっくり過ごして
日頃の疲れを取っていってくださいね
MsgEn:
Spend time with your Partner Pawn
and rest away your daily fatigue!

MsgJp:
《覚者の自室》のことなら
何でも私に相談してくださいね！
MsgEn:
If you have any questions about 《Arisen's Room》
please contact me for anything you need!

MsgJp:
どなたかお探しですか？
現在こちらにいらっしゃった方は
別用にて不在です
MsgEn:
Are you looking for someone?
The person you are looking for
is currently absent for another matter.

MsgJp: 時を改め、再度おいでください
MsgEn: Please come again at a later date.

MsgJp: おや、何かご用ですか？
MsgEn: Oh, how can I help you?

MsgJp:
ここで一汗かいて、自室でゆっくり風呂に入って
夕方になったら酒場に繰り出す――
そんな風に神殿の中で過ごす休日ってのも
中々いいんじゃないか？
MsgEn:
After breaking a sweat here,
I'll take a leisurely bath in my room
and then head to the tavern in the eve.
Spending holidays like that in the Temple...
Sounds good, don't you think?

MsgJp: 待たせたな、ようやくここも本始動だ！
MsgEn:
Thanks for waiting.
Finally this place is starting to come alive!

MsgJp:
神殿内で武器を構えるのは禁止だろ？
でも、新しいスキルを好きに試して
みたいって時もあるじゃないか
MsgEn:
You're not allowed to hold a weapon
in the Temple, right?
But there are times
when you just want to try out your new skills.

MsgJp:
そんな時に思う存分暴れ回っても大丈夫なのが
この《鍛練の小部屋》だ！
思いっきり使っていってくれよ！
MsgEn:
In times like that, 
what allows you to freely rampage 
to your heart's content is this "Training Room"!
Go ahead and use it to your heart's desire!

MsgJp:
スキルとスキルを上手く繋げられるか確認したりさ
他にも新しいジョブをじっくり試したい時とか――
結構使いどころは多いと思うぜ
MsgEn:
You can confirm if you can masterfully
connect skills together,
or you want to thoroughly try out new jobs...
There are a lot of situations where it's useful!

MsgJp:
ま、使い方は人それぞれだから
お前はお前のやり方で活用してくれればいいよ
MsgEn:
The beauty of this is that it's flexible!
Use it in a way that inspires you
and brings out your own creativity.

MsgEn: Yo, how 'bout a quick workout?

頑張ればギリギリ、いける――？
MsgEn:
It might be a little tough for me alone--
If I work hard, I can just barely make it...

MsgJp: 誰かに見つかる前に何とかしないと――

MsgJp:

意味が無いんだよね――
何とかならないかな――
MsgEn:
There's no point in having a treasure
that everyone knows about――
Isn't there some way to make it work somehow――

MsgJp:
く――、ままならんものだ
被造物に手を焼かされるなど――
MsgEn:
Urgh, it's quite a predicament.
Dealing with troublesome creations...

MsgJp:
今となっては錬魔の存在自体が忌々しい！
道理を解せぬケダモノに
我々が脅かされるとはな
MsgEn:
Nowadays,
the very existence of alchemists is detestable!
To be threatened by beasts
who cannot comprehend reason,
such a thing is unacceptable.

MsgJp:
おのれ、錬魔の制御さえ取り戻すことが
できれば――！
MsgEn:
If only I could regain control
over the Alchemized...!

MsgJp:
ああ、お前は地上から来た者だな
――何か用か？
MsgEn:
Ah, so you are someone
who has come from the ground, aren't you?
... Do you have some business here?

MsgJp:
ああ、これほど狭くなったメルゴダだが
立ち入れぬ場所は多い
困ったものだよ
MsgEn:
Ah, Mergoda has become so small
with many off-limits places.
Quite troublesome, indeed.

MsgJp:
君たちがここへきてくれたことは
我々にとっても大きな変化だ
それが良いのか、悪いのかはまだ分からないが
MsgEn:
The fact that you all have come here
is a significant change for us as well.
Whether it is good or bad, we still do not know.

MsgJp:
少しでも資源を集め、錬魔を防がなければ――
居住区すらいつまでも安全とは限らないからね
MsgEn:
We must gather resources, meager as it may be,
and prevent the Alchemized from wreaking havoc.
Because even the residential areas
are not guaranteed to be safe forever.

MsgJp: ああ、何か用かな？
MsgEn: Oh, what can I do for you?

MsgJp:
ああ――
せめて安全に、メルゴダ内を歩くことが
できればいいのですが――
MsgEn:
Oh--
I wish I could at least walk safely 
through Mergoda...

MsgJp:
居住区に住まうみなにとって、錬魔の脅威は
共通の問題なのです
自らが生みだした問題ですが、今となっては
解決する術もなく――皮肉なものですね
MsgEn:
For everyone living in the residential area,
the threat of the Alchemized is a common problem.
It is an issue that they themselves have created,
but now there seems to be no way to solve it.
- Quite ironic, isn't it?

MsgJp:
地上の方も、散策する際は錬魔にご注意ください
いつどこから襲われるともしれませんので
MsgEn:
Please be cautious of the Alchemized
when exploring the surface world.
You never know when or where they'll strike.

MsgJp: ご機嫌いかがですか？　地上の方
MsgEn: How are you feeling, land-dweller?

MsgJp:
エリクシルとは錬金の真髄
事象の本質を抽出し、凝縮し、そして
解放する――
錬金を学べば分かることですよ。ウフフ――
MsgEn:
The Elixir is the essence of alchemy.
It extracts, condenses,
and liberates the essence of phenomena--
That's what you'll understand 
when you learn alchemy. Hehe--

MsgJp:
あなた、地上から来た人ですね――？
だってその格好、見たことありませんから
MsgEn:
You, are you someone who came from the ground--?
Because I've never seen that appearance before.

MsgJp:
ああ、この次は何を錬成いたしましょう
あれか、これか――
悩ましいですね――ウフフ
MsgEn:
Ah, what should I synthesize next?
Hmm, is it that... or this?
Perplexing... Ufufu.

MsgJp: ――あら、私に何かご用でしょうか？
MsgEn: --Oh, my dear, what can I do for you?

MsgJp:
ああ、頭がくらくらしてきた――
でも、も、もうちょっとだけ――
MsgEn:
Ah, my head is spinning...
But, just a little bit more...

MsgJp:
いやぁ、もう頭までぽかぽか来ちゃって
ほんともう――
な、長湯しすぎかな
MsgEn:
Aah, my head is all warm and fuzzy.
I've been soaking in the bath
for far too long, haven't I?

MsgJp:
やぁ、調子はどうだい？
ここの温泉、すっごく効くよ
そりゃもう体力がじわじわ溢れ出すほどさ――
MsgEn:
Hey, how fare thee?
The hot springs here are great.
They're so good that they'll slowly
flood your body with energy...

MsgJp: ああ、え？　何か言った――？
MsgEn: Ah, eh? Did you say something--?

MsgJp: ウギャ！

MsgJp: 人間キライ！
MsgEn: Hate humans!

MsgJp: ウガ、ウガ――
MsgEn: Ugga, ugga--

MsgJp: ぐぅおおおおお――
MsgEn: Gooohhhh――

MsgJp: がぁあっは――
MsgEn: Gah ah ah ah ah--

MsgJp: ぐおおおお！
MsgEn: Gooooooooohh!

MsgJp: あぁあああああ！！
MsgEn: Ah, aaaaaahhhhh!!

MsgJp:
スピリットランサーは自然の力を活かして戦う
大地、空気、水、木々や雷――
全ての力に感謝することを忘れるな
MsgEn:
The Spirit Lancer fights 
by harnessing the power of nature.
The earth, air, water, trees, and lightning—
Never forget to give thanks to these forces.

MsgJp:
異国の覚者がスピリットランサーを
志すということも、あるものなのだな
MsgEn:
It is indeed possible for an Arisen
from a foreign land
to aspire to become a Spirit Lancer.

MsgJp:
スピリットランサーを志し、同じ師を仰ぐ以上
我らは兄弟弟子ということになる――
不思議な感覚だが、悪くはない
MsgEn:
As long as we aspire to be Spirit Lancers
and look up to the same master,
we are brothers and disciples--
An odd feeling, but not a bad one.

MsgJp:
大いなる自然の加護を受けし者よ
さらに鋭き精霊槍を求めるならば
力添えしよう
MsgEn:
O blessed one by the great forces of nature,
If you seek an even sharper Spirit Lance,
I shall assist you.

MsgJp:
師であるアデルドナハには及ばぬが
俺も鍛練を積んだスピリットランサーだ
お前の修練くらい造作もない
MsgEn:
While I may not reach the level of my master,
Adair Donnchadh, I am also a Spirit Lancer
who has undergone rigorous training. 
It's similar to your regimen, indeed.

MsgJp:
最近は魔物もずいぶんと凶暴になってきてるわ
あなたも気を付けることね
MsgEn:
Demons grow more ferocious these days.
You better watch out, too.

MsgJp: あら、見慣れない方ね
MsgEn: Oh, you don't look familiar.

MsgJp:
ご機嫌よう――
今日もいい風ね
MsgEn:
Greetings.
Nice breeze today.

MsgJp:
――私からは特に話すべきことは無いわ
あなたは？
MsgEn:
--I don't have anything special to tell you.
What about you?

MsgJp:
珍しいものと面白い話――
僕はそれらを追い求めることに人生を捧げたいんだ
MsgEn:
Unusual things and interesting stories--
I want to dedicate my life to pursuing them.

MsgJp:
毎日同じことを繰り返し、魔物に怯えて
そして疲れ果てて眠るだけの毎日なんて
まっぴらゴメンだね
MsgEn:
Every day, repeating the same thing,
and living in fear of monsters.
Sorry, but I can't stand a life like that.
No way.

MsgJp:
へ？　仕事をしてないように見えるって？
僕が面白い話を探して旅をするだろ
その道中で色んな――面白くはない話も――聞くだろ
で、その話を聞くために金を払うヤツは多いのさ
MsgEn:
Huh? You think I don't look like I'm working?
I travel in search of interesting stories.
Along the way, I'll hear various—
even uninteresting— stories.
And there are many people who pay money
just to hear those stories.

MsgJp:
情報を売ってる、っていうのかな
その金でまた旅に出られるわけ――
正直な話、金には困ってないよ
MsgEn:
I'm selling information, I guess you could say.
That money will get me on the road again--
I'm not hurting for money, to be honest.

MsgJp: よぅ、何か面白いものでも持ってるのか？
MsgEn: Yo, got something interesting for me?

MsgJp:
はぁ――ワクワクするものが欲しい――
君も、何かこれぞというものを見つけたら
ぜひ教えてくれよ
MsgEn:
Haah... I long to feel exhilaration.
If you happen to find something
that truly captures that feeling,
let me know about it!

MsgJp:
歩いて渡るのは危険だ
たとえ覚者であろうと――
――俺としては勧められないな
MsgEn:
It is dangerous to cross on foot,
even if you are an Arisen――
――I cannot recommend it.

MsgJp:
川を渡りたいのなら
船を出そうか？
MsgEn:
If you want to cross the river,
I can take you there by boat.

MsgJp:
あまり増水すると船も出せない
ここ最近は水量が安定していて助かる
MsgEn:
If the water rises too high,
we can't even launch the boat.
Thank goodness the level is stable these days.

MsgJp:
水の流れに逆らわず利用することで
体力を節約しながら漕げるんだ
MsgEn:
By going with the flow of the water,
you can save energy while rowing.

MsgJp: 外、歩くのタノシイ――
MsgEn: It's so nice to walk outside.

MsgJp:
オレ、あやしくない
お前気にしなくていい
MsgEn:
I'm not faking it.
You don't have to worry about it.

MsgJp: ヌ、なんだ？
MsgEn: Wh-what's it?

MsgJp:
オレの村、遠いとこ
ここらへん、マダ慣れてない――
MsgEn:
My village, far away.
Not used to here, this place--

MsgJp:
あなたに授けられる《復活力》の加護は
1度に3回分まで――
お忘れなきよう
MsgEn:
The "Revival Power" blessing you will receive 
is limited to three at a time--
Don't forget that.

MsgJp:
必要とあらば、貴方のために
貴方を加護する竜へと祈りを捧げましょう
それが、私の役目であるようです
MsgEn:
If necessary, I shall offer a prayer
to the Dragon that protects you.
This is also my task.

MsgJp:
異なる竜に仕える覚者よ
私の祈りが必要でしょうか？
MsgEn:
Oh, Arisen who serves a different Dragon,
have you need of my prayers?

MsgJp:
この者が仕える竜よ、《復活力》のご加護を――
あなたの覚者が、三たび倒れども
立ち上がることができますよう――
MsgEn:
Lord Dragon, upon this individual may you bestow
your Divine Protection of "Revival Power"
so that your Arisen may rise again,
even if they fall thrice--
and stand once more.

MsgJp:
――おや、あなたは既に本日《復活力》の加護を
受けられたご様子
加護を受けられるのは日に１度です
わかっておいででしょう？
MsgEn:
Oh, it seems you have already received
the divine protection of Revival Power today.
Please note that you can only receive
this protection once a day.

MsgJp:
おや、異なる竜に仕える方よ
既に《復活力》の加護で満たされていますね
MsgEn:
O servant of another Dragon,
you are already filled with the Divine Protection
of "Revival Power."

MsgJp:
加護を失いし時にこそ、私をお訪ねください
どうか良き旅を
MsgEn:
When you have lost the Divine Protection,
come visit me.
Good travels, Ser.

MsgJp:
おや、まだ《復活力》の加護に
守られておいでですね
残っている復活力を捨て、新たな復活力を
授かりますか？
MsgEn:
Oh, my,
you are still under the Divine Protection
of "Revival Power."
Will you discard the remaining revivals
and receive a new blessing?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
では、今日も大いなる竜のご加護が
あらんことを――
MsgEn:
May the great Divine Protection
of the Dragon be with us today as well...

MsgJp:
私は本来、精霊竜様とその覚者様をお助けするため
《芯なる樹》にいたのですが
このような状況となり、ダナへと参りました――
MsgEn:
I originally resided within the Core Tree,
assisting the Spirit Dragon
and its Arisen in their endeavors.
However, due to the current circumstances,
I have come to Dana—

MsgJp:
私はこの場に居るべきだと感じたのです
――それがこのフィンダムのためになる
今も、そう信じています
MsgEn:
I felt that I should be here.
―― It will benefit Phindym.
Even now, I believe so.

MsgJp: 大いなる竜の加護は、常に貴方と共に――
MsgEn:
May the blessings of the Dragon Protection
always be with you.

MsgJp:
あら――
私はわかっていますよ
貴方は竜に仕える覚者でしょう
MsgEn:
Oh... I understand.
You must be an Arisen who serves the Dragon.

MsgJp:
――やることがあるんだ
用が無いなら、放っておいてくれ
MsgEn:
There are things to do――
If you've no business with me,
please leave me alone.

MsgJp:
まったく――
私なんかより、無駄話が好きな奴らに
声をかけた方が楽しいんじゃないか
MsgEn:
I mean--
Wouldn't it be more enjoyable
to approach people who,
unlike someone like me,
actually enjoy idle chatter?

MsgJp: ――何か用でも？
MsgEn: Need something?

MsgJp:
君は外にいる時も
そんな大声で話すのか？
獲物が逃げるから、静かにした方がいい
MsgEn:
Do you talk that loud when you're outside too?
You'd better be quiet
or your game will run away.

MsgJp: ホッホッホ、メリークリスマス！
MsgEn: Ho-ho-ho, Merry Christmas!

MsgJp:
ホッホッホ！
順調に幸せの挨拶が
広まっているようでなにより――
MsgEn:
Ho-ho-ho!
It's heartwarming to see these happy greetings
spreading so widely――

MsgJp:
ん？　この笑い声かね？
実はわしは声が大きい方らしくて――
大口を開けて笑うと、子供たちが怖がってしまう
そこで口をすぼめて笑っているのだ
MsgEn:
Huh? This laughter?
Actually, I seem to have a loud voice—
When I laugh loudly, children get scared,
so I put on a big smile instead.

MsgJp:
従者たちも、わしの任務には大賛成だ
それぞれ楽しみながら勤めてくれている
MsgEn:
My attendants are also wholeheartedly
in favor of my duties.
Each one diligently fulfills their tasks
while thoroughly enjoying themselves.

MsgJp:
人の笑顔を見ることほど楽しく、嬉しいことはない
もうずいぶんと生きているが
これは変わらんものだなぁ
MsgEn:
There is nothing more fun and joyful
than seeing people smile.
I've been alive for a long time now,
and this is something that will never change.

MsgJp: メリークリスマス、覚者様
MsgEn: Merry Christmas, Arisen.

MsgJp:
神殿に季節の幸せを広める
お手伝いができたならば
この恰好をした甲斐もあったというものです――
MsgEn:
If I can help spread seasonal joy in the temple,
it will have been worth it to dress up like this--

MsgJp:
主いわく、今年の私の装いのテーマは
「可愛さ、親しみやすさ」だそうです
ミーアとも“お揃い”なのだそうで――
MsgEn:
According to the master,
this year's theme for my attire
is "cuteness & approachability."
It seems I'll be "matching" with Mia as well—

MsgJp:
皆さんが「メリークリスマス」と口にされる度
そのお声を聞いている我々にも
幸せを分けていただいているような気がします
MsgEn:
Every time you all say "Merry Christmas,"
it feels like you're sharing happiness with us
just by hearing your voices.

MsgJp:
あら、覚者さま
それではご一緒に！
メリークリスマース！
MsgEn:
Oh, Master Arisen!
Well, join us then!
Merry Christmas!

MsgJp:
あたしの話し方ですか？
こういう風にしているとですね
例えば、ちょっとシャイな子供でも
お友達になってくれるんですよ
MsgEn:
Is it the way I talk?
If you do it this way, for example,
even a shy child will become your friend!

MsgJp:
主がそれを望まれているから
あたしはそのようにするのです！
MsgEn:
Because my master wants it,
that's what I'll do!

MsgJp:
この恰好で寒くないのか、ですか？
だーいじょうぶ！
心はいつもホッカホカです！
MsgEn:
Am I cold in this outfit, you say?
I'm doing great!
My heart is always warm!

MsgJp:
それに、主のお傍にいると
何となく温かいんですよね！
これ、あたしが主のポーンだからって
わけじゃないと思うんですけど
MsgEn:
Besides, when I am by Master's side,
I feel warm somehow!
I don't think this is because
I'm my Master's Pawn, though.

MsgJp:
幸せの挨拶、続けてますか？
さっ、今年も高らかに！
メリークリスマース！
MsgEn:
Spreading joyful cheer?
Now, let's proclaim it loudly again this year!
Merry Christmas!

MsgJp: ああ、ジフール砦の件だな？
MsgEn: Ah, is this about the Jifule Fortress incident?

MsgJp:
ここ《フェルヤナ荒原》にあるジフール砦――
幾度となくオーク達に占領されてきたが
その度に取り返してきた
MsgEn:
The Jifule Fortress,
located here in the Feryana Wilderness,
has been occupied by the Orcs numerous times,
but we have always managed to reclaim it.

MsgJp:
そこに異国の覚者の力が加われば
怖いものなしだな！
――本当に、頼りになる存在だよ、お前たちは
MsgEn:
If the power of foreign Arisen is added there,
there will be nothing to fear!
Truly, you lot are all reliable fellows.

MsgJp:
お前たちの姿を見るだけで
勇気づけられるという者も多いんだ
MsgEn:
Many of us are encouraged
by the mere sight of you.

MsgJp:
ダクレイム砦の奪還は鮮やかだったな！
――今回も頼りにしてるぞ
MsgEn:
The recapture of Dacreim Fortress was brilliant!
- I'm counting on you again this time.

MsgJp:
ジフール砦に出撃する前に
少し休んでいきたいということか
俺の顔で安く泊まれるように案内しよう
<VAL PRICE_INN>はかかるが、それでいいか？
MsgEn:
Before heading out to Jifule Fortress,
you want to rest a bit, huh?
Let me guide you to a place
where you can stay cheaply using my connections.
It will cost <VAL PRICE_INN>, is that okay?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
疲れが溜まると本来の力を発揮できなくなる
お前がそうなると困ることばかりだ！
休みたいならそこらで好きに休憩していってくれ
誰にも文句は言わせないからさ
MsgEn:
If you grow weary,
you won't be able to unleash your true power.
Brings only trouble if you end up like that!
If you want to rest,
feel free to take a break wherever you like.
I won't let anyone complain, so go ahead.

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
《弱化の治療》か
もちろん出撃前には大切なことだよな
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>くらいでどうだ？
MsgEn:
Need to "Treat Weakness," huh?
Of course, it's important to do that
before going into battle, right?
How about <VAL PRICE_WEAK>?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
――んん？
どこら辺が《弱化》してるんだ――？
すまないが、よくわからんな
MsgEn:
--Hmm?
In what manner are you "Weakened"?
I'm sorry, I don't understand.

MsgJp:
おいおい、既に別のミッションを
受注しているじゃないか
MsgEn:
Hey now,
you've already taken on another mission.

MsgJp:
こちらのミッションへ出撃する場合は、
今受注しているミッションを解散してから
改めて尋ねてきてくれ
MsgEn:
If you are going to sortie on this mission,
please dissolve the mission
you are currently undertaking and then ask again.

MsgJp: はい、戦技の付け替えでしょうか？
MsgEn: Yes, is it about changing combat skills?

MsgJp:
強敵に挑む時や
効率よく敵を薙ぎ払う必要がある時――
戦技を付け替えるのは、非常に重要なことです
MsgEn:
When facing formidable enemies,
or when efficiently dispatching foes—
it is crucial to change your combat skills.

MsgJp:
敵や状況に合わせて
スキルやアビリティを付け替える――
一見手間なように思えますが
実は効率化への重要なポイントなんですよ
MsgEn:
Depending on the enemy and the situation,
you can change your skills and abilities--
It may seem like a hassle at first glance,
but it's actually a key point to efficiency!

MsgJp:
装備も戦技も、磨いてこそ
そして状況に合わせてこそ、です
MsgEn:
Both equipment and combat skills
must be honed and adapted to the situation.

MsgJp: よく来てくれた、異国の覚者よ
MsgEn: Welcome, Arisen from a foreign land.

MsgJp:
ダクレイム砦はこのエリアの第一線の１つだ
悪しき竜軍が支配するか、
我々解放軍が制圧するか――
この戦いの要となるだろう
MsgEn:
Dacreim Fortress is at the frontline.
Whether it will be conquered
by the forces of the Evil Dragon
or reclaimed by our Liberation Army...
It will surely be the key to this battle.

MsgJp:
解放軍には、元々兵士でもなんでもなく
ただ必要に駆られて所属している者も多い――
MsgEn:
In the Liberation Army,
there are many who are not originally soldiers,
but rather individuals who have been compelled
to join out of necessity.

MsgJp:
貴方が協力してくれるのは
戦力的にも、精神的な支えとしても
とてもありがたいことだ
MsgEn:
It is truly appreciated
that you are willing to cooperate,
both in terms of combat strength
and a source of emotional support.

MsgJp:
異国の竜の加護を受けながら
アッカーシェランに力を貸してくれる覚者よ
貴方の武運を祈ろう
MsgEn:
While receiving the Divine Protection of Dragons
from a faraway foreign land,
O Arisen who lends power to Acre Selund,
I pray for your good fortune in battle.

MsgJp:
他ミッションへエントリーしている最中だろう
ウォーミッションへ出撃する際は、
今エントリーしているミッションの参加予定を
取り消して来てくれ
MsgEn:
You must be in the middle
of entering another mission.
When you sortie for a War Mission,
please cancel your participation
in the previously accepted mission and try again.

MsgJp:
ああ、カトブレパスに乗る時は
ちょっとしたコツがいるんですよ
お手伝いしましょうか？
MsgEn:
Ah, when riding a Catoblepas,
there are a few tips you need to know.
Shall I assist you?

MsgJp:
こうして大人しくしている間は
可愛いとすら思えるんですけどねぇ
MsgEn:
As long as she's quiet like this,
I even think she's cute!

MsgJp:
そりゃぁ、普段の扱いにも
細心の注意を払ってますよ！
馬や牛とは違いますから
MsgEn:
That's because we are very careful 
in our daily handling!
They are not like horses or cows.

MsgJp:
あ、防護してありますけど
万が一カトブレパスの涙が漏れていたときには
絶対に触らないでくださいね！
絶対にですよ！
MsgEn:
Ah, there are protective measures,
but just in case Catoblepas tears are leaking,
please absolutely do not touch it, okay?
Absolutely, I mean it!

MsgJp: やあ、あんたが白き竜の覚者さんか
MsgEn: Hey, are you the Arisen of the White Dragon?

MsgJp:
このほこらに漂っている
《英霊の魂》を集めて
私に捧げてくれないかい？
MsgEn:
Would you collect the《Souls of Heroic Spirits》
that float in this dust and offer them to me?

MsgJp:
そうすれば、あんたに力を貸してやれる――
何せ今は何の力も無くってね
MsgEn:
If you do that, then I can lend you my strength—
after all, I don't have any power right now.

MsgJp:
これだけの《英霊の魂》、よく集めてきたね
おかげで何かと良い感じだよ
MsgEn:
You've done an amazing job
collecting all these Souls of Heroic Spirits.
Thanks to that, things have been going well.

MsgJp:
見たところ、あんたなら
もっと深くまで潜ることもできそうだし――
MsgEn:
From what I can see,
you could probably delve even deeper...

MsgJp:
少しだけ時間をくれたら
この土砂をどけておくよ、約束する
MsgEn:
If you give me some time,
I promise to clear away this sediment.

MsgJp:
どうだい？
土砂をどけて、道を作っておいたよ
これで先に進めるだろう
MsgEn:
How about it?
I cleared away the debris and made a path.
You should be able to proceed now.

MsgJp:
あんたほどの実力があるなら
この先に眠る宝物にもたどり着けるんじゃない？
MsgEn:
If the Arisen as good as they say you are,
you'll find those treasures that lie ahead,
won't you, Ser?

MsgJp:
期待してるよ――
ああ、久しぶりに楽しかった
MsgEn:
I'll be waiting—
Ah, I haven't had this much fun in a while.

MsgJp:
すまないけど、思ったより
土砂が詰まっててね
さすがに時間がかかってしまってるんだ
MsgEn:
Sorry, Ser.
It's more packed with sediment than I thought.
It's taking longer than expected.

MsgJp:
もう少しだけ時間をくれない？
なに、目途は立ってるからさ
MsgEn: Can you give me a little more time? No, I've got a plan.

MsgJp: はい、ご用はなんでしょうか
MsgEn: Yes, what can I do for you?

MsgJp:
地熱には恩恵を受けることも
逆に困らされることもあります
MsgEn:
Both benefits and drawbacks can be derived 
from geothermal energy.

MsgJp:
ここで、この装備で――
暑くないといえば嘘になりますが
ある程度は慣れました
MsgEn:
Here, with this equipment...
It would be a lie to say it's not hot,
but I've gotten somewhat used to it.

MsgJp: ご武運を祈っております
MsgEn: I wish you the best of luck.

MsgJp:
いや、うちの姐さんがたは
人使いが荒いのなんのって
MsgEn:
No, my sisters...
They're very rough with people.

MsgJp:
おっといけねぇ
聴こえちまうとこだった
MsgEn:
Whoops, that was close.
Almost heard that.

MsgJp:
いろいろと世話になりやしたね
キャリーの姐さんには
感謝してます
MsgEn:
I have been greatly indebted to you in many ways,
Lady Carrie.
I am truly grateful to you.

MsgJp:
おっと！
もちろん覚者さんにも！
MsgEn:
Oops!
Of course, even to you, Ser Arisen!

MsgJp:
復活した大食堂の噂
俺ら盗賊団でも話題ですぜ
さっそく食べに行ったやつもいるほどで
MsgEn:
The rumor of the resurrected grand cafeteria
has even become a topic among our band of bandits.
Some of us have already gone to eat there.

MsgJp:
一度くらい顔出したいとこなんですがね
あいにく、用事を山ほど言いつけられちまって
MsgEn:
I would like to show my face at least once, 
but unfortunately, 
I've been given a mountain of tasks to do.

MsgJp:
本当は直接言いたいところですが――
キャリーの姐さんに
よろしく言っておいてくだせぇ
MsgEn:
I would like to say it directly, but... 
Please give my regards to Carrie, Ser.

MsgJp:
盗賊の武器はやっぱり
“あし”だと思うんでさ
MsgEn:
I think the best weapon of a bandit is 
definitely their "legs".

MsgJp:
“速く――静かに――いつの間にか”
これが俺のモットーでして
MsgEn:
"Fast--quiet--before you know it."
That's my motto.

MsgJp:
当然、“履物”にも
並々ならぬこだわりを持ってやしてね
MsgEn: Naturally, we are also very particular about our "footwear".

MsgJp: 「軽くて楽で履きやすい」
MsgEn: "Lightweight, comfortable, and easy to wear."

MsgJp:
なんと言っても
これに尽きるってもんです
MsgEn:
What can I say?
It all comes down to this!

MsgJp:
戦技の付け替えでしたら
ぜひ、お手伝いさせてください
MsgEn:
If it's about changing combat skills,
please let me assist you.

MsgJp:
そうだ――スキルだけでなく
アビリティもこまめに見直してみてください
MsgEn:
That's right - not just skills, 
make sure to regularly review your augments.

MsgJp:
アビリティは一度付けたら
そのままにされる方も多いようですが
状況に応じて付け替えてこそ
真価を発揮するものなのです
MsgEn:
Many people seem to leave their augments as they 
are once they are equipped, but it is when they 
are switched according to the situation that 
they truly demonstrate their worth.

MsgJp:
スキルのような見た目の派手さはありませんが
アビリティのレベルも
上げれば上げるほど強力になりますよ
MsgEn:
While it may not have the flashy appearance of 
skills, as you increase the level of your 
abilities, they will become more powerful.

MsgJp:
これはこれは、いらっしゃいませ！
王都メガドで商うこと150年
由緒ある我が店でどうぞお買いものを！
MsgEn:
Welcome, welcome! We have been trading in the 
royal capital of Megado for 150 years. 
Please feel free to shop at our esteemed store!

MsgJp:
ええ、当店は代々メガドで
商いをさせていただいておりますよ
メガドでのお買い物といえば当店！
自信をもってお勧めする品の数々！
MsgEn:
Yes, our store has been doing business in Megado 
for generations. 
When it comes to shopping in Megado, 
it's our store! 
We confidently recommend a variety of products!

MsgJp:
――え？　ロスギルのエルセン商会？
確かに私と名前こそ似ておりますが
血縁などではございませんよ
MsgEn:
Oh? The Rothgill Trading Company, you say? 
While it is true that our names are similar, 
we are not related in any way, mmm.

MsgJp:
あんな田舎のケチな商売人たちと
一緒にしないでいただきたいですねぇ
MsgEn:
I would appreciate it if you didn't lump me 
together with those stingy businesspeople from 
such a rural area, mmm.

MsgJp:
ささ、覚者さま
本日はどのような物をお探しで？
MsgEn:
Greetings, Master Arisen.
What kind of item are you searching for today?

MsgJp:
いらっしゃいませ、覚者さま！
王都メガドでのお買いものなら
《滅びの渦》にも負けない当店で！
MsgEn:
Welcome, Master Arisen!
For your shopping in the Royal Capital Megado,
choose our store that won't lose 
to the Vortex of Stagnation!

MsgJp:
何があろうと、そう
私の命が尽きる瞬間まで
店は開けると心に決めたのです
MsgEn:
No matter what happens, 
until the moment my life comes to an end, 
I have decided in my heart to keep the shop open.

MsgJp:
覚者さま、物資については
ご心配なさらず！
当店はいつでも、覚者さまをサポートいたします！
MsgEn:
Master Arisen, 
Please don't worry about supplies!
Our shop will always support you, 
Master Arisen, anytime!

MsgJp:
この世界が滅びるというのであれば
私は“メガドの商人”として
終わりを迎えてやろうと思いましてね
MsgEn:
If this world is going to die,
I'll be the "Merchant of Megado"
til meet the end.

MsgJp:
バザーでの売買をお考えでしょうか
より良い取引のため、精一杯お手伝いいたします
MsgEn:
Considering buying & selling at the Bazaar?
We will do our best to assist you 
for a better transaction.

MsgJp:
小さなお店ですけど
バザーの取引には問題ありませんよ
安心してご利用くださいね
MsgEn:
It's a small shop, but there are no issues with 
bazaar transactions. 
Please feel free to use it with peace of mind.

MsgJp:
遅くまで働くのは大変です
でも、まだ小さな弟もいますから――
MsgEn:
Working late is tough
But I still have a little brother, so...

MsgJp:
家族を失う人も多いなか、弟を
育てられるのは幸せなことだと思います
MsgEn:
Among the many people who have 
lost their families, I think it is fortunate 
that I am able to raise my younger brother.

MsgJp:
本当は行き場の無い子供たちの面倒も
見てあげたいんですけど――
うちも食べるだけで精一杯ですから――
MsgEn:
I really want to take care of the children who 
have nowhere to go...
But we're barely able to feed ourselves, so...

MsgJp:
はい、バザーは今日も行われていますよ
お取引のお手伝いならお任せください
MsgEn:
Yes, the bazaar is being held today as well. 
If you need assistance with your transactions, 
please leave it to me.

MsgJp:
かわいそうに
親を失った子供たちは
今頃どれほど不安な思いをしているか――
MsgEn:
How pitiful it is.
The children who have lost their parents,
How much anxiety must they be feeling right now...

MsgJp:
弟が、空の渦を怖がるので
ずっと家の窓を閉めているんです
まだ幼いながら、大変なことが起こっていると
わかるのでしょうね
MsgEn:
My younger brother is afraid of the vortex,
so I've been keeping the windows of 
our house closed all the time.
Even though he is still young, he must understand
that something terrible is happening, right?

MsgJp:
本当はずっと弟についていたいんです
でも、お店を開かないと
明日、そして明後日に食べる物が――
こうしている瞬間にも、迷うことばかり――
MsgEn:
I want to stay with my younger brother forever.
But if I don't open the shop,
there won't be anything to eat tomorrow, 
and the day after tomorrow--
Even in moments like this, 
I'm constantly filled with doubt--

MsgJp:
さぁさぁ、お疲れでしょう
メガドでお休みならうちへどうぞ！
MsgEn:
Come, come, you must be tired.
If you want to rest at Megado, come to our place!

MsgJp:
覚者さまのためなら
一番いいお部屋を<VAL PRICE_INN>で
ご用意いたしますよ！
寝心地も眺めも最高なんですから！
MsgEn:
For our esteemed Master Arisen,
We will prepare the finest room for you 
at the price of <VAL PRICE_INN>!
Both the comfort and the view 
are simply outstanding!

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
いえいえ、他ならぬ覚者さまですから
無料でご案内いたしますとも！
もちろんお休みになりますよね？
MsgEn:
No, no, since it's none other than Master Arisen,
I'll guide you there for free, of course!
You'll be taking a break, right?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
まぁー、弱化なさっているなんて
お辛いことでしょう
《弱化の治療》は<VAL PRICE_WEAK>ですよ
早速取り掛かってもよろしいでしょうか？
MsgEn:
Oh my, I can't believe you've been weakened.
I'm so sorry you're in pain.
The cure for weakness is <VAL PRICE_WEAK>.
May I get right to it?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: Yes

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: No

MsgJp:
あらあら、ここにいらっしゃるまでに
治ってしまわれたみたい――
さすがは覚者さまですね！
MsgEn:
Oh my, it seems you have already been healed 
before coming here. 
Truly, you are a remarkable Arisen!

MsgJp:
うちはメガドでいっちばん古くからある
宿屋なんですよ！
古くて狭そうに見える？
――それが“味”ってものじゃないですか
MsgEn:
Our inn is the oldest one around in Megado!
It looks old and cramped, doesn't it?
—But that's what gives it its charm, right?

MsgJp:
長くやっている宿屋ですから
かつてはお忍びで居住層に遊びにいらした
王族もお泊りになったとか、ならないとか――
MsgEn:
Since we've been in business for a long time,
it's said that royalty used to come and stay here 
incognito to visit the Residential Level.

MsgJp:
戦いに出る方は、宿でついでに
戦技を見直されることも多いんでしょう？
だから、戦技補佐ができる人に
いてもらうことにしたんですよ
MsgEn:
For those who go into battle, it's quite common 
for them to also take the opportunity to reassess 
their combat skills at the inn, right? 
That's why I decided to have someone who can 
provide arts support there as well.

MsgJp:
ええ、ええ
宿は営業していますとも！
どうぞごゆっくりお休みくださいね
MsgEn:
Yes, yes.
The inn is definitely open for business!
Please feel free to rest and relax.

MsgJp:
覚者さまも何かとお疲れでしょう
せっかくアッカーシェランに
来ていただいているのですから
やわらかなベッドくらいご用意しなければね
MsgEn:
Master Arisen, 
you must be tired from your activities. 
Since you have come all the way to Acre Selund, 
we must prepare a soft bed for you.

MsgJp:
オークがメガドに攻め入ってきた時は
これ以上酷いことなんて無いと
思ったものですけどね――
MsgEn:
When the orcs invaded Megado,
I thought there couldn't be anything worse than 
that, but well...

MsgJp:
覚者さま、ぜひ疲れを取ってから
ご出発くださいね
わたしたちには、このくらいしか
できないものですから
MsgEn:
Master Arisen, please rest and recover
before you depart.
We can only do so much for you, after all.

MsgJp:
王子がさ、わたしやメイロワ将軍にも
休みが必要だからって
そんなこと、気にしなくていいのに
MsgEn:
The prince says even I and General Meirova 
need a break.
Don't worry about it, honestly.

MsgJp:
ああ、この水着？
ええと、背の低い――
そう、キャメロンって子が貸してくれたんだ
MsgEn:
Ah, this swimsuit?
Hmm, the short... 
Yes, Cameron lent it to me.

MsgJp:
きれいなデザインだよね
紐や飾りなんかも繊細で――
平和な場所じゃないと、着られない
MsgEn:
It's a beautiful design, isn't it?
Even the strings and decorations are delicate...
You can only wear it in a peaceful place.

MsgJp:
やっぱりレスタニアでは落ち着く？
いつもよりのびのびして見える
――いいね、そういう顔も
MsgEn:
Is it calming in Lestania after all?
You seem more relaxed than usual—
It suits you.

MsgJp:
このサングラス、可愛いでしょー？
キャメロンって子が水着と合わせて
コーディネートしてくれたんだ！
いい子だよね、あの子！
MsgEn:
These sunglasses, aren't they cute?
That girl Cameron coordinated it with a swimsuit!
She's such a good girl, that one!

MsgJp:
海、きれいだねぇ！
魚もいっぱい泳いでたよ
万が一の時には、あたしが捌いてあげるからね！
MsgEn:
The sea is so beautiful!
There were lots of fish swimming around.
If by any chance something happens, 
I'll handle it for you!

MsgJp:
ねぇねぇ、そこら辺に転がってるスイカって――
あっ、やっぱ食べちゃダメだよね！
飾りだよね、アレは
MsgEn:
Hey, hey, those watermelons lying around--
Oh, you shouldn't eat them, right?
It's just for decoration.

MsgJp: やぁ、素敵なビーチへご招待ありがとう
MsgEn: Hey, thanks for inviting us to your lovely beach!

MsgJp:
それが君の“夏の装い”か
なるほど、良いと思うよ
普段とは違った魅力がある
MsgEn:
Is that your "summer attire"?
I see, I think it looks good.
It has a different charm than usual.

MsgJp:
それにしても美しい海だ
透き通っていて、いくら見ていても飽きない
風も柔らかくて気持ちいいしね
MsgEn:
That being said, it is a beautiful sea.
It is so clear, 
and no matter how much you look at it, 
you never get tired.
The breeze is also nice and soft.

MsgJp:
私も、厳密にはもう“ハイセプター”ではないから――
そうだな――もう少し年を取ったら
異国を巡る旅に出るのもいいかもしれない
MsgEn:
I, too, am no longer strictly a "High Scepter" now
--Well, when I get a little older,
It might be nice to embark on a journey 
to foreign lands.

MsgJp:
さっき、君の訓練官に会ったよ
「夏は開放的な気分になるから」と大騒ぎしていたな
――君もそうかい？
MsgEn:
I met your trainer earlier.
They were making a big fuss, 
saying, "Summer feels so liberating."
Are you feeling the same way?

MsgJp:
ここには専属の警備の者たちがいるそうだ
精霊槍の持ち込みも遠慮してくれと
言われてしまった――
MsgEn:
I heard there are exclusive security guards here. 
They even asked me to refrain from 
bringing my Spirit Lance...

MsgJp:
この平穏なる光景、白竜の慈しみによって
維持されているということを忘れるな
MsgEn:
Do not forget that this peaceful scene is 
maintained by the benevolence of the White Dragon.

MsgJp:
――ただ波の音に耳を傾け
無心に己の精神と向き合ってみるのも良いな
どうだ、貴様もそこに座って
少し心を落ち着けていくか
MsgEn:
—Just listen to the sound of the waves,
and try facing your own mind without distraction.
How about it? Sit there too,
and let your heart calm down for a bit.

MsgJp:
わははは！
このビーチではわしのことを知る者なぞ
そう居るまい！
久しぶりに、全力で遊ぶとするかな
MsgEn:
Wahaha! 
On this beach, 
there'll be no one who knows of my existence! 
It's been a while, so I'll play with all my might.

MsgJp:
ここだけの話だがな
――ジリアンに悪い虫が近付かぬよう
こっそり見張っているのだ
MsgEn:
Just between you and me
--I'm quietly keeping an eye out
so no pesky bugs come near Gillian.

MsgJp:
翡翠湖の深い色合いも美しいが
空の色を映したようなここの海もまた美しい
心が洗われるようだ！
MsgEn:
The deep hues of Emerald Lake are beautiful,
But this sea here, 
reflecting the colors of the sky, 
is also beautiful.
It feels as though my heart is being cleansed!

MsgJp:
覚者よ、夏だな！
その恰好を見るに、泳ぐ準備は万端か
MsgEn:
Arisen, it's summer!
And judging by your attire, you're ready for a swim.

MsgJp:
去年のにぎわいを見て
俺も今年は水着を用意したんだ
――たまにはこういった
非日常を楽しむのいいものだな
MsgEn:
Looking at the excitement of last year,
I also prepared a swimsuit for this year.
It's nice to occasionally enjoy
such extraordinary experiences.

MsgJp:
レンテンはあのサングラスが気に入ったようだ
神殿でも、目を離すと付けたり外したりしていた
気分の切替えはしてほしいものだが――
まぁ、大目に見よう
MsgEn:
Renton seems to have taken a liking 
to those sunglasses.
Even in the temple, he would put them on and 
take them off when no one was looking.
It would be nice if he could change his 
mood a bit, though...
Well, I'll let it slide.

MsgJp:
せっかくのビーチだ！
最新の水着にサングラスで
ばっちりキメてきたぜ！
MsgEn:
It's finally the beach! 
I've dressed up perfectly in the 
latest swimsuit and sunglasses!

MsgJp:
さて、一泳ぎしてこようかな
あんたも一緒に行こうよ
これも訓練の一環だって！
MsgEn:
Well, I think I'll go for a swim.
You can come with me too.
It's part of the training!

MsgJp:
え？　仕事？
アーチボルトさんだって来てるんだから
ちょっとくらいいいだろ
まぁ、ちょこちょこ様子は見に戻るからさ
MsgEn:
Huh? Work? 
Even Archibald is here, so it should be 
fine to take a little break, right?
Well, I'll go back and check on things from time to time.

MsgJp:
さぁ、ハロウィン！
仮装とお菓子で盛り上がりましょ！
MsgEn:
Come on, Halloween!
Let's have fun with costumes and sweets!

MsgJp:
今年のお菓子はふんわりパクパク食べられる
プチマフィンと、濃厚な味を楽しめるヌガーよ
どう？　食べたくなってきた？
MsgEn:
This year's snacks are soft and crunchy 
petite muffins and richly flavored nougat.
What do you think?　Are you getting a craving?

MsgJp:
お祭りのために白竜神殿に来るのを
アンジェロも私もとっても楽しみにしてるの！
だから念入りに準備してるんだけど――
MsgEn:
Angelo and I are very much looking forward to 
coming to the White Dragon Temple 
for the festivities!
So we've been preparing for it very carefully...

MsgJp:
お祭りが終わった後でも
お菓子を食べると元気になるのは
きっと楽しい記憶を思い出すからよね
MsgEn:
Even after the festival is over,
eating sweets and becoming energized
must be because it brings back joyful memories.

MsgJp:
だからお祭りっていうのは
目いっぱい楽しくなきゃダメなのよ！
良い「楽しさ」っていうのは
その時だけのものじゃないの
MsgEn:
That's why festivals have to be full of fun!
Good "fun" is not just for the moment!

MsgJp: アノ　オカシ――
MsgEn: That pastry...

MsgJp:
オナカ　ヘタ
ズト　ズト――
MsgEn:
Stomach... Hurts...
Gonna... Gonna...

MsgJp: ミナイデ
MsgEn: Don't look.

MsgJp: ママ　ママ――
MsgEn: Mama, mama--

MsgJp:
見つかっちまったか
この変装は失敗だな
MsgEn:
Spotted.
This disguise is a disaster.

MsgJp:
何じろじろ見てやがる
言っとくが、こりゃあ私服じゃねぇぞ
MsgEn:
Why are you staring at me like that? 
Just so you know, this ain't civilian clothing.

MsgJp:
あ？　何か文句でもあんのか？
商人の服っつったら
やっぱりこれだろうが
MsgEn:
Huh? You got a problem or somethin'? 
When it comes to a merchant's attire, 
this is definitely it, right?

MsgJp:
最初は神官の服を渡されたんだけどよ
あんなもんぜってぇ着るかって
辛気臭え気分になっちまう
MsgEn:
At first they gave me a priest's uniform, 
but I'd never wear such a thing, 
it makes me feel like a psycho.

MsgJp:
ここら辺はまだ神殿の近くだ
見つかるのも無理はねぇな
“祝いの品”も小出しでいいだろ
MsgEn:
This area is still near the temple.
It's not impossible to find something.
"Celebration gifts" can be small.

MsgJp:
ああ！？
お前こんなとこまで
追いかけてきやがったのか！？
MsgEn:
Ah!?
Did you really chase after me
all the way here!?

MsgJp:
気分転換にフンパツして
《豊穣の湯》まで来たってのに――
なんだってお前の顔見ながら
湯に浸からないといけねぇんだか
MsgEn:
I came all the way to the "Abundance Springs" 
for a change of mood, and yet... 
why do I have to soak in the hot water while 
looking at your face?

MsgJp:
リズやらエリオットを
引き連れて来てないだけまだマシか
あいつらがいると、一人頭で
10倍は騒がしくなるからな
MsgEn:
It's still better that I didn't bring 
Lise and Elliot along. 
With them around, 
it would be ten times more chaotic.

MsgJp:
はぁ――
ま、その行動力っつうか
突き進む信念みてぇなのがお前の持ち味だもんな
“祝いの品”受け取れよ、この湯に免じて多めに渡すぜ
MsgEn:
Haah...
Well, I guess your strong sense of determination 
or, shall I say, forward-thinking, 
is your strong suit.
Accept this "congratulatory gift", and I'll give 
you a little extra in honor of this hot spring.

MsgJp:
おいおいおい
こんな場所で、こんな変装までしてるのに
なんで追いかけて来られるんだ！？
MsgEn:
Oi oi oi,
Even in a place like this, and even in disguise,
Why are they able to chase after me?!

MsgJp:
なんだってこう見つかっちまうんだ？
背筋が薄ら寒くなってきやがった
MsgEn:
How the hell did they find us?
I'm getting chills down my spine.

MsgJp:
ま、これからもよろしく頼むわ
お前みたいなやつが味方で良かったぜ
――敵になったら最悪の気分だったろうな
MsgEn:
Well, keep up the good work.
I'm glad to have a guy like you on my side.
--I would have felt terrible if you were my enemy.

MsgJp:
ったく、何が「一番見つかりにくい場所と変装」だ
クラウスのやつ、適当なこと言いやがって
MsgEn:
Jeez, what's with this 
"most inconspicuous hiding spot and disguise"?
That Klaus guy just says whatever he wants.

MsgJp:
実は、ジョゼフともう一つ賭けてたんだよな
ここにいるのを見つけられなきゃ
“祝いの品”の大部分は
俺の物ってことになってたんだが――
MsgEn:
Actually, I had made another bet with Joseph.
If they couldn't find you here,
the majority of the "celebratory gift"
would have become mine--

MsgJp:
しかたねぇ、俺の負けだ！
ああ、負けだ！
ドカッと渡すからありがたく受け取れよ！
MsgEn:
There's no helping it, I've lost!
Ah, it's a defeat!
Here you are, take it all!

MsgJp:
よう、まぁちょっと
話でも聞いていけや
MsgEn: Well, um, why don't you listen to the story for a bit?

MsgJp:
よう、三周年だってな
おめでとうさん
MsgEn:
Hey, it's our third anniversary.
Congratulations!

MsgJp:
で、だ――
突然だけどよ、これから俺はレスタニアの
あちこちに隠れることになった
MsgEn: So, listen up. I suddenly have to hide in various places in Lestania from now on.

MsgJp:
俺を３か所で見つけることができたら
“祝いの品”ってやつをプレゼントっつうわけだ
まぁ気張って探し回ってくれや
MsgEn:
If you can find me in three places,
I'll give you a "celebration gift."
Well, keep your eyes peeled.

MsgJp:
――はぁ？　誰が好きでこんなことするか
ジョゼフのジジイとの
ちょっとした賭けに負けちまって
この役割を押しつけられたのよ
MsgEn:
Huh? Who would willingly do something like this?
I lost a small bet with Joseph's old man 
and got stuck with this role.

MsgJp:
クソッ、勝てたらだいぶと
ウマい内容だったんだがな――
あのジジイ、ほとんど魔物みてぇなもんだ
賭けの誘いになんて乗るんじゃなかったぜ
MsgEn:
Damn, it would have been a lot better if I won.
It was a good one--
The old man was almost like a demon,
I should never have taken that betting offer.

MsgJp:
よしッ！
気合を入れていこう！
MsgEn:
Alright!
Let's get fired up!

MsgJp:
どんな衣装を着ても
新たな魅力を振りまいてくれるのが
そう、シェリーちゃんだ！
小悪魔系から清楚ガールまでただ一人で完全網羅！
MsgEn:
No matter what outfit she wears,
Shelly always radiates a new charm.
Yes, it's Ms. Shelly!
She's the one who can perfectly cover everything, 
from devilish to innocent girl!

MsgJp:
その微笑みで何度でも新鮮な感動をくれる！
むしろ、隣に立っている姿が視界に入るだけで
驚くほど感動してしまう――わかるだろう？
MsgEn:
That smile gives me a fresh sense of wonder 
again and again! 
In fact, 
just the sight of her standing next to you is
amazingly inspiring - you know what I mean?

MsgJp:
シェリーちゃんの今回の衣装、どうかね？
カワイイだろう？　最高だろう？
うむうむ、わかるとも
MsgEn:
What do you think of Ms. Shellys outfit this time? 
Isn't it cute? Isn't it the best? 
Mmm, mmm, I understand.

MsgJp:
実は水色の衣装も用意していたのだが
今回は白でいきたくてね――個人的に
MsgEn:
Actually, 
I had prepared a light blue outfit as well,
but 
this time I wanted to go with white personally.

MsgJp:
今度のプレゼントはすごいぞ
ココだけの話、喜ばれる自信が――ある！
なんといっても“女心”について
これでもかと本を読んで勉強してきたからねッ！
MsgEn:
The present this time is amazing, you know.
Just between us, 
I have confidence that it will be well-received!
After all, I've studied and read books about 
"a woman's heart", extensively!

MsgJp:
ハァイ、バレンタインぶりね
とってもワクワクしてるわ！
MsgEn:
Hi, it's been a while since Valentine's Day.
I'm feeling really excited!

MsgJp:
このスカートのボリューム！
すっきりした上半身とのコンビネーションが
今の気分にジャストなの
コンパクトさがキュートな靴も見てほしいポイントよ
MsgEn:
The volume of this skirt!
The combination with the clean upper body
is just what I'm in the mood for right now.
Also, pay attention to the cute 
compactness of the shoes.

MsgJp:
あのね、アンジェロと一緒にいると
楽しいと感じることや次にやりたいことが
お互いにどんどん湧いてくるの
MsgEn:
You know, when I'm with Angelo, 
I feel so happy and we both constantly come up 
with things we want to do next.

MsgJp:
毎日新鮮で、なのに全然疲れないっていうか
――何ていうか――ううん――ー
アンジェロってとびきり不思議な人なのよ
MsgEn:
Every day, it's fresh, 
and yet I don't get tired at all, or rather, 
how should I put it... 
hmm... 
Angelo is a truly mysterious person.

MsgJp:
ねぇ、今回のアンジェロったら
とってもかっこいいと思わない！？
ロングジャケットの紳士なシルエット――
最高にエスコートされたくなっちゃう
MsgEn:
Hey, don't you think Angelo looks 
really cool this time?
With his gentlemanly silhouette in a long jacket..
I can't help but want to be escorted by him, 
it's the best.

MsgJp: なんだ、やけに楽しそうな顔してるな
MsgEn: You look like you're having a great time.

MsgJp:
ったく、あいつらが神殿に来ると毎回大騒ぎだな
浮かれることしか頭に無いペアってやつか
ま、お似合いなんじゃねぇの
MsgEn:
Geez, every time those guys come to the temple, 
it's always a big fuss. 
They're a pair who only care to have fun, huh? 
Well, I guess they suit each other.

MsgJp:
「誰か一人に一つだけ」ってのも
悪くはねぇんだけどよ
俺はやっぱ数で勝負っつぅのが
わかりやすくて好きだわ
MsgEn:
Having 'one for each person' isn't necessarily a 
bad idea. 
But personally, I prefer competing with numbers. 
It's just more straightforward.

MsgJp:
こりゃまた、騎士団の奴らが
悔しがりそうなメンツだな
MsgEn:
Well, well, this looks like a lineup that would 
make the knights really envious.

MsgJp:
今回は食い物じゃなさそうだな
柔らかい何か――開けてみるとするか
MsgEn:
Doesn't look like food this time.
Something soft-- let's open it up.

MsgJp:
――ソファカバーか！
さてはこの間、俺が
家具職人を呼んだのを見てただろ
MsgEn:
Oh, a sofa cover, huh? 
You must have seen when I called the furniture 
craftsman the other day.

MsgJp:
ったく、粋なことしてくれるじゃねぇか
大きさもちょうど良さそうだ
一瞬、何を持ってきたのかと思ったが
こういうのなら悪かねぇ
MsgEn:
Jeez, you're doing something pretty cool.
The size seems just right too.
For a moment, 
I thought what you brought was something else,
but this is pretty good.

MsgJp:
やたらブワブワした感触なのは――
まぁ、冬だからありっちゃありだな
MsgEn:
The sensation of bubbling is quite strong—
well, I guess it's to be expected in winter.

MsgJp:
今晩家に帰る楽しみができたわ
ありがたくいただいとくぜ！
MsgEn:
Now I have something to look forward to when 
I get home tonight.
I'll take it!

MsgJp:
あっ！　隊長じゃないか
キミもそこに座りなよ
MsgEn:
Ah! It's the captain. 
Why don't you sit there too?

MsgJp:
ちょっとちょっと
メイロワ将軍もいるなんて聞いてないぞ
いや、別にいたからどうってワケでもないけど
MsgEn:
Wait a minute, wait a minute!
I didn't hear that General Meirova would be here too.
Well, I don't mind him being here, but...

MsgJp:
バレたらマズいことが
いくつかあるってだけさ！
MsgEn:
It's just that there are a few things
that would be bad if they were found out!

MsgJp:
いや～、異国にお呼ばれするなんて
軍師やっててよかったよ、ホント！
観光ついでに色々勉強させてもらおうかな
MsgEn:
Being invited to a foreign country like this...
I'm glad I became a strategist, really!
Maybe I should... 
I'm sure I'll learn a lot while I'm sightseeing.

MsgJp:
さっき聞いたんだけど、なんでも
力が湧いてくる温泉があるんだって？
気になるなぁ、ぜひとも行ってみたいなぁ
案内してくれる人がいればなぁ～
MsgEn:
I just heard that there's a hot spring where 
everything comes to life with power?
I'm curious... I'd love to go there.
If only I had someone to show me around!

MsgJp:
ここの酒場ってツマミ以外もあるのかな？
できればシチュー的な物で温まりたいよ
MsgEn:
Does this tavern have anything other than snacks? 
If possible, 
I'd like something like stew to warm up.

MsgJp:
待ちくたびれたよ――
でも、キミが何かくれるはずだと思って
ずっと待ってたんだ
MsgEn:
I've been waiting for ages――
But I've been waiting all this time, 
thinking you'd give me something.

MsgJp:
さぁ、早速だけど見せておくれよ！
その“特別”ってやつを！
MsgEn:
Let's see what you've got!
Let's see what's so "special" about it!

MsgJp: ああ、コレはアレだね！
MsgEn: Oh, this is the thing!

MsgJp:
アレ――テーブルに飾る布！
テーブルセンターっていうんだっけな
ずいぶんオシャレな物をくれるじゃないか！
隊長、ありがとう！
MsgEn:
That thing - a cloth to decorate the table!
I think it's called a table centerpiece!
You've given me something very stylish!
Thank you, Captain!

MsgJp:
知ってるかもしれないけど
ほら、僕の持ち物ときたら
大体どこかへ逃げだすのが得意だからさ
MsgEn:
You might know this already, but my belongings, 
you know, have a knack for running off somewhere.

MsgJp:
これはなくならないように
家にある一番大きなテーブルの
一番広くて良い場所に敷いておかないとだ！
MsgEn:
To ensure that this doesn't disappear,
it must be put on the largest table in the house,
in the widest and best spot!

MsgJp:
ああ、そうそう
これが無くなってしまっていないか
隊長が様子を見にきてくれてもいいんだよ
――ほんとにいつでも、見にきてくれていいから！
MsgEn:
Ah, yes, that's right.
I wonder if it's still here.
It would be nice if the captain could come and 
check on it.
-Really, anytime is fine, so please come and look!

MsgJp: 今年もこの季節が来ましたね！
MsgEn: It's that time of year again!

MsgJp:
こうして、隊長と楽しめる催しに
また呼んでもらえて――光栄です！
MsgEn:
I am honored to be invited back for another event 
that I can enjoy with my captain!

MsgJp:
気になっていることがあるんです
あの二人が、一体どこでアッカーシェランの
人たちを知ったのかって――
MsgEn:
There is something I'm curious about. 
Where exactly did those two learn about the 
people of Acre Selund?

MsgJp:
ジョゼフ様に相談したのか、それとも
実は偵察能力がすごかったりするんでしょうか
――前者は考えにくいですよね
MsgEn:
Did you consult with Mr. Joseph, or
actually have great detective skills?
--The former is unlikely, isn't it?

MsgJp:
酒場の雰囲気、結構好きなんですよ
次の休み、みんなで何か食べに来ませんか
もちろんリズも誘って
MsgEn:
I really like the atmosphere of the tavern. 
How about coming to eat something together on our 
next day off? Of course, let's invite Lise too.

MsgJp:
神殿でゆっくりすることって
最近あんまり無い気がして
MsgEn:
I feel like there hasn't been much time to 
relax at the temple recently.

MsgJp:
あっ、ありがとうございます！！
やったッ！
隊長からのプレゼント、嬉しいです！
MsgEn:
Oh, thank you!
Yay!
I'm so happy to receive this gift from you!

MsgJp:
この色、隊長が選んでくださったんですよね？
すごく素敵です
いえ、もともと好きな色なんですけど！
大好きな色になりました
MsgEn:
Did the captain choose this color for me?
It's really wonderful.
No, it's actually a color I've always liked!
It has become my favorite color.

MsgJp:
あの――これ、俺が隊長の右腕として
直々に認められた証だって
思っていてもいいですか？
MsgEn:
Can I think of this as proof that I have been 
personally recognized as the right hand of the 
captain?

MsgJp:
そうだと思うと、神殿から
どんな勲章をもらうよりも
ずっと誇らしい気持ちに――
何よりも、明日への励みになりますから
MsgEn:
When I think of that, I feel much more proud
than when I receive any medal from the Temple--
because, more than anything else, 
it encourages me for tomorrow!

MsgJp:
――ということで
しばらくは額に入れて飾っておきます！
敷物として使うなんて勿体ないですしね
覚悟ができたらちゃんと使いますよ！
MsgEn:
-- so
I'm going to frame it and display it for a while!
It would be a shame to use it as a rug.
I'll use it properly when I'm ready!

MsgJp:
ああ、覚者
レスタニアの“祭り”だそうだな
にぎわってるじゃないか
MsgEn:
Oh, Arisen,
I hear it's a "festival" in Lestania.
It's a lively place.

MsgJp:
席についていると話しかけられるだろう
俺はここにいるくらいでちょうどいい
MsgEn:
I will probably be approached while seated.
It's just right for me to be here.

MsgJp:
ああ、コレは――レスタニアでなら
顔を隠す必要も無いかと思ったが
何となく落ち着かなくてな
MsgEn:
Ah, in Lestania, I thought there would be no need 
to hide my face, but for some reason, 
I can't seem to calm down.

MsgJp:
相棒、後で一杯飲みに行かないか？
レスタニアの酒の味をみてみたいんだ
静かな店を知ってたら、連れていってくれ
MsgEn:
Hey partner, maybe we can grab a drink later?
I'd like to see what the drinks taste like 
in Lestania.
If you know a quiet place, take me there.

MsgJp:
クク――いや、よく考えたら
お前が俺のところに持ってきたって
驚くようなことじゃなかったな
付き合いの深さは、時間の長さじゃ計れない
MsgEn:
Kukuh... Well, now that I think about it,
it wasn't really surprising that you 
brought me here.
The depth of our connection cannot be 
measured by the length of time.

MsgJp:
この布は――ストールか
ちょうどいい
これからの季節、アッカーシェランでも
夜は冷え込むんだ
MsgEn:
Is this cloth... a stole?
It's just right.
In this season, even in Acre Selund,
the nights get cold.

MsgJp:
家に帰ったら羽織ってみることにしよう
セムやジャンにも見せてやりたい
きっとお前に会いたがるだろうよ
MsgEn:
When I get home, I'll try putting it on and show it to Shem and Jan. 
They would definitely want to see you.

MsgJp:
さて――帰る前に、相棒
一杯飲みに行かないか？
レスタニアの酒の味をみてみたいんだ
静かな店を知ってたら、連れていってくれ
MsgEn:
Now then, before we go back, partner,
how about going for a drink?
I'd like to taste the alcohol in Lestania.
If you know a quiet tavern, please take me there.

MsgJp:
今度メガドに来るときに
隠れた名店を教えてやるから
交換条件といこう
MsgEn:
Next time you come to Megado,
I'll show you some hidden gems.
Let's call it an exchange.

MsgJp: お招きいただき感謝する！
MsgEn: Thank you for inviting me!

MsgJp:
酒場が明るく賑わうのは
良い町の証拠だ！
さすがは白竜様のお膝元といったところだな
MsgEn:
The fact that the bars are bright and bustling is
evidence of a good town!
That's what you'd expect from 
the White Dragon's hometown.

MsgJp:
気分転換になにかしたいと思っていたところだ
そこへ異国の祭りとはうってつけだ！
MsgEn:
I've been looking for something to do for a change
and an exotic festival is just the thing!

MsgJp:
もう少し落ち着いたらば
アッカーシェランでも、何か
みなで楽しめる催しを考えてみるか
MsgEn:
Once things have calmed down a bit,
How about we think of some event
that everyone can enjoy,
even in Acre Selund?

MsgJp:
おおっ！？
本当にわしがもらってもよいものなのか？
――では、ありがたくちょうだいしよう
MsgEn:
Oh?!
Is this really something I can have?
--Well, I'll take it gratefully.

MsgJp:
膝掛けか！
使いやすそうな大きさではないか
それに、触っているとなんとも楽しくなる手触りだ
MsgEn:
A lap blanket!
It's an easy size to use,
and what a fun texture to touch!

MsgJp:
アッカーシェランに帰っても
これに触れれば今日のことを思いだすだろう
MsgEn:
Even when I return to Acre Selund, if I touch 
this, it will surely remind me of today.

MsgJp:
異国の祭りに呼んでいただいただけでなく
おぬしから贈り物までもらえるとは
いや、長生きもしてみるものだな！
MsgEn:
To be invited to a festival in a foreign land
and even receive gifts from you—
Well, long living has its perks!

MsgJp:
ワハハ、いやー楽しい日だ
よし！　せっかく酒場にいるのだ
今日はおぬしも共に飲もうではないか！
朝まで飲み明かすという手もあるぞ！
MsgEn:
Wahaha, what a fun day! Alright then! 
Since we're already in the tavern, 
let's drink together, shall we? 
We could even drink until morning!

MsgJp:
隊長！　こんにちは
ふふ、どうかしましたか？
MsgEn:
Captain! Hello.
Hehe, what's the matter?

MsgJp:
お招きいただき、ありがとうございます
とても嬉しいです
みなさんとの時間を持つことができて――
MsgEn:
Thank you for inviting me.
I'm so glad to have time with you all--

MsgJp:
わたしがここに来られるなんて
白竜さまの導きによるものでしょうか
MsgEn:
I can't believe I'm here.
I wonder if it's because of the 
White Dragon's guidance?

MsgJp:
こうしたお祭りはないけれど
フィンダムの若者も、想いを伝えるために
贈り物をするんですよ
MsgEn:
While we don't have such festivals,
even the Phindym youth give gifts to 
convey their feelings.

MsgJp:
部族によっても違いがありますが
花やアクセサリーを贈る人が多いみたいです
モルフォールでは本も人気だと聞きますね
MsgEn:
It varies from tribe to tribe.
Many people give flowers and accessories.
I hear that books are also popular in Morfaul.

MsgJp:
レスタニアにはまた来てみたいと思ってたんです
それが叶うなんて！
今目の前に広がっている光景――夢のようです
MsgEn:
I had been thinking that I wanted to come 
back to Lestania.
To think that it would actually come true!
The scenery unfolding before my eyes right now... 
it feels like a dream.

MsgJp:
これを、わたしに？
ありがとうございます！
MsgEn:
Is this for me?
Thank you very much!

MsgJp:
きれいな手紙ですね
紙も、文字も凝っていて
特別なものなんだって一目でわかります
MsgEn:
It's a beautiful letter.
Both the paper and the writing are elaborate,
and I can tell at first glance 
that it's something special.

MsgJp:
隊長、わたし――
みなさんと出会って
たくさんのことを知りました
MsgEn:
Captain, with you--
I have learned many things
since meeting everyone.

MsgJp:
今、また新しく知ることができて
本当に幸せなんです
こんなにあたたかな気持ち、いつぶりでしょう
MsgEn:
Now, I am able to learn something new again.
I am truly happy.
How long has it been since I felt such warmth?

MsgJp:
あと少しだけ、ここにいてもいいですか？
隊長と過ごせる時間が楽しくて、夢みたいで――
こんな夢なら、もう少し
見ていたいと思ってしまうんです
MsgEn:
Can I stay here for a little while longer?
I'm enjoying the time I get to spend with the captain, it's like a dream--
If it's a dream like this, 
I'd like to watch it a little longer!

MsgJp:
わたしなら楽しんでるよ
心配しないで
MsgEn:
If it were me, I would be enjoying myself.
Don't worry.

MsgJp:
この酒場はいいね
海と空、両方を眺められる
それに楽しげな人がたくさんいるし
MsgEn:
This tavern is nice.
You can enjoy the view of the sea and the sky.
And there are many cheerful people here.

MsgJp:
この夏、レスタニアの海に招待してもらったけど
神殿に来るのは初めて
MsgEn:
I was invited to the beach in Lestania this summer, 
but this is the first time I've been to the
temple.

MsgJp:
アッカーシェランとは
似ているところも多いけど、やっぱり
違うところもたくさんあるみたいだ
MsgEn:
There are a lot of similarities with Acre Selund, 
but it seems there are still a lot of differences.

MsgJp:
この前、メイロワ将軍が招待されたらしいけど
どんな様子だった？
ううん、ちょっと気になるだけ
MsgEn:
I heard General Meirova was invited the other day.
How did he look?
No, just wondering.

MsgJp:
待って
それ、わたしが受け取ってもいいもの？
“特別な贈り物”だって聞いてたけど
MsgEn:
Wait.
Can I take that?
I heard it's a "special gift," but...

MsgJp:
違う？　わたしのために用意してくれたの？
――それじゃあ、もらっておくよ
ありがとう
MsgEn:
Is that not so?　Did you get it for me?
--I'll take it then.
Thank you.

MsgJp:
変わった紙に、絵みたいな文字
見慣れない様式だけど――きれいな手紙だ
これ、アッカーシェランまで大事に
持って帰りたいな
MsgEn:
On this peculiar paper, 
there are characters that look like drawings.
It's an unfamiliar style, 
but it's a beautiful letter.
I want to take good care of it 
and bring it back to Acre Selund.

MsgJp:
ここのところ、伝令の持ってくる
書類ばっかり見てたから
何だか緊張するよ
MsgEn:
Lately, I've been feeling nervous because I've 
been constantly looking at the documents brought 
by the messengers.

MsgJp:
――あのさ、変なこと聞くけど
こういう贈り物ってどう返事したらいい？
突然慣れないことばっかりで――
MsgEn:
- Um, hey, I know this is a strange question, but
how should I respond to this kind of gift?
Everything is so unfamiliar and sudden...

MsgJp:
えっと――そうだ
今度こっちに来るときにでも
神殿を案内してほしいんだけど
あなたに
MsgEn:
Let's see-- yes,
next time you're here,
I'd like you to show me around the temple.

MsgJp: 隊長！　今回も楽しもうね！
MsgEn: Captain!　Let's have fun again this time!

MsgJp:
戦ってばかりは疲れちゃうから
こういうお祭りがもっとあるといいな
MsgEn:
I'm tired of fighting all the time.
I wish there were more festivals like this.

MsgJp:
ねぇねぇ、シェリーの着てる服
とっても可愛いよね！
今回の服もアンジェロが選んだんだって！
MsgEn:
Hey, hey, what Shelley is wearing
is very cute!
Angelo picked out her outfit this time too!

MsgJp:
それにしても、二人とも白くて豪華な服だし――
何かを連想しちゃわない？
そういうつもりじゃないのかなぁ
MsgEn:
That being said, 
both of them are wearing elegant white clothes...
Doesn't it make you think of something?
I wonder if they didn't intend it that way...

MsgJp:
先月はガルドリンとエリオットが
ここに呼ばれてたでしょ？
羨ましかったんだ～
MsgEn:
Last month, 
Gurdolin and Elliot were called here, right? 
I was so jealous~

MsgJp:
やったぁ！　そうこなくっちゃ！
なになに――？
わぁ、手紙――？
MsgEn:
Yay! I did it! That's how it should be done!
What's this...?
Oh, a letter...?

MsgJp:
うーん
何か良い感じのことが書いてあるのは
わかるんだけど――
言い回しが難しいっていうか――
MsgEn:
Hmm, I can understand that there's something 
written here that has a good feeling to it, but... 
it's hard to put it in the right way...

MsgJp:
あ、でも字が凝ってて素敵だね！
紙も綺麗な色だし、このまま飾っても
良さそうなくらいお洒落だよ
この感じ、わたし好きだな～
MsgEn:
Ah, but the lettering is so intricate and lovely!
The paper has such beautiful colors, 
it's stylish enough to be displayed just as it is.
I really like this feeling~

MsgJp:
なんでだろう
最初はよくわからないと思ったのに
見てるとどんどん嬉しくなっちゃう
MsgEn:
I wonder why...
At first, I didn't really understand,
but the more I look, the happier I become.

MsgJp:
――あ、そっか、隊長からもらったから嬉しいんだ！
この手紙、大切にするね
隊長、ありがと！
MsgEn:
- Ah, I see. 
I'm happy because I received it from the Captain! 
I'll treasure this letter.
Captain, thank you!

MsgJp: うん、何かな？
MsgEn: Yeah, what is it?

MsgJp:
レスタニア、君が護るべき国だね
一度この目で見てみたかった
招待、感謝するよ
MsgEn:
Lestania, the country you're supposed to protect.
I've always wanted to see it with my own eyes.
Thank you for the invitation.

MsgJp:
こうしてたくさんの人と話したり
誰かと共にテーブルにつくのは久しぶりじゃないかな
ここが異国だからか、気分転換にもなるよ
MsgEn:
It's been a while since I've talked to 
so many people, or sat at a table with someone.
Maybe it's because this is a foreign land, 
but it's refreshing.

MsgJp:
火山が無いと、空はここまで透き通って見えるのか
どちらの空が良いというわけではないけど
私はやっぱり、アッカーシェランの
人間なんだなと思って――
MsgEn:
Is it because there are no volcanoes that the sky 
looks so clear here?
I'm not saying that one sky is better 
than the other, but I guess I'm still an 
Acre Selund woman, after all.

MsgJp:
一度受け取ったら
もう返せないけど――
ありがたくいただいてしまおうか
MsgEn:
Once I take it,
I can never return it――
then I'll take it gratefully.

MsgJp:
手紙――
ああ、この紙も普通の物じゃないね
手触りが独特だし、少し変わった香りもする
MsgEn:
Letter--
Yeah, this paper is no ordinary one either.
It has a unique texture and an unusual scent.

MsgJp:
――紙も、言葉も、文字のデザインも
これだけ揃えるのは大変だったろう
MsgEn:
-- the paper, the words, the lettering design...
It must have been hard to get all this together!

MsgJp:
このひとひらの中に
君が私のためにと考えてくれたものが
詰まっているんだね
MsgEn:
Within this petal,
you've packed something
that you've thought of for me, haven't you?

MsgJp:
まいったな
この素晴らしい贈り物への返礼として
渡せるものが、今の私には何もない――
MsgEn:
I'm in trouble.
I have nothing to offer as a return 
for this wonderful gift...

MsgJp:
そうだ――今度、お茶しに来ないかい
最近ようやく、とある焼き菓子を
それらしく作れるようになったんだ
ぜひ君に感想を聞かせてほしい
MsgEn:
That's right―― 
How about coming over for tea next time? 
I've finally managed to make a certain type of 
baked confectionery that looks the part. 
I really want to hear your thoughts on it, 
so please come and try it.

MsgJp: ふふふ、何かしら
MsgEn: Hmmm, what is it?

MsgJp:
舞台にいる彼――
あたくしの住まいに来た瞬間に
ひれ伏さんばかりだったの
よっぽど怖かったのかしら
MsgEn:
He, on stage――
The moment he entered my abode,
He was about to prostrate himself.
I wonder if he was that scared.

MsgJp:
《パッションパピルス》で作った紙のこと？
もちろん知っているわぁ
かなり前に流行した品ね
MsgEn:
You mean the paper made from Passion Papyrus?
Of course I know what it is.
It was all the rage a long time ago.

MsgJp:
したためられた想いを
より強く相手の心に届けると言われているわ
MsgEn:
It is said to make your thoughts and feelings
reach the other person's heart more strongly.

MsgJp:
もっとも、それは魔術を扱える者が作ったもののみ
町の人が興味本位で作った紙に
そんな力は無いから、すぐに廃れてしまったの
MsgEn:
However, only those who can wield magic 
can create such things. 
The paper made by the townspeople out of 
curiosity had no such power, 
so it quickly fell into obscurity.

MsgJp:
まだ少し風が冷たいでしょう
薄着の子たちには、ほんの短い間だけ
暖かい空気をまとえるようにしてあげる
MsgEn:
The wind is still a little chilly, isn't it?
For the lightly dressed children,
let's give them a brief moment
to be wrapped in warm air.

MsgJp:
《パッションパピルス》の手紙――
あたくしにこの手紙を渡すなんて
勇気があるのね？
MsgEn:
Letter from 《Passion Papyrus》 --
You have a lot of courage to give me this letter,
don't you?

MsgJp:
紙や文字はさておいて
――なんてかわいらしい詩なの
嬉しいわ、この詩は
あたくしのためだけに編まれてここにあるのね
MsgEn:
Setting aside paper and words—
what a lovely poem.
I'm delighted; this poem
was crafted solely for me, here.

MsgJp:
まだまだつたないところもあるけれど
手に余る技術を駆使するよりも
素直な感性こそが響くというもの――
ふふ、よくわかっているじゃない
MsgEn:
There may still be some imperfections, 
but it's the genuine emotion that resonates,
more than any overwhelming technique――
Oh, you understand very well.

MsgJp:
でも、もっと上手に歌いたいのなら
あたくしが手ほどきをしてあげてもよくってよ
MsgEn:
But if you want to sing better,
I can teach you.

MsgJp:
美しいさえずりは
その翼をもより良く見せるのですもの
羽ばたきの日まで、楽しませてちょうだい
MsgEn:
A beautiful chirp makes even its wings look better.
Let me enjoy it until the day it takes flight!

MsgJp: こんにちは、ご機嫌いかが？
MsgEn: Hello, how are you?

MsgJp:
こういう日の、特別な空気もだいすき
後で思い出しても楽しい気持ちになるから
MsgEn:
I really love the special atmosphere of days like 
this, because even when I remember it later, 
it brings back delightful feelings.

MsgJp:
今回も、レスタニアとは違う大陸からの
お客さんが来てるんだね！
仲良くなれたらいいなぁ
MsgEn:
Again, I see you have guests from a different 
continent than Lestania!
I hope we can get to know each other.

MsgJp:
お祭りの時だけここに来るあの二人――
旅をしているって言ってたけど
どのくらい遠くまで行ったことがあるのかしら
MsgEn:
Those two who only come here during the festival..
They said they were traveling, 
but I wonder how far they have actually been.

MsgJp:
わぁ、ありがとう！
すてきなお手紙――
MsgEn:
Wow, thank you!
What a wonderful letter--

MsgJp:
このお手紙、いい香りがするね
なんだか懐かしいような、ずっと前から
知ってるような香り
MsgEn:
This letter has a nice scent, doesn't it?
It somehow feels nostalgic, 
as if from a long time ago.
A familiar scent that I seem to know.

MsgJp:
今晩から枕の下にこのお手紙を入れてみようかな
香りで今日のことを思い返して
ワクワクした気持ちで眠れそう
MsgEn:
Shall I put this letter 
under my pillow from tonight?
With its scent, I can reminisce about today
and sleep with an excited feeling.

MsgJp:
あのね、生きていくなかで
わたしが大切にできる物は
きっと限られているのだと思うけど――
MsgEn:
You know, in the midst of living,
I think there are only a few things
that I can truly cherish.

MsgJp:
このお手紙は、ずっと大切にする！
約束するね！
わたしと覚者様が仲良しだっていう証だもの
MsgEn:
I will treasure this letter forever!
I promise!
It's proof that you and I, Ser Arisen, 
are good friends.

MsgJp: 何か言いたいことでもあるのか？
MsgEn: Is there something you want to say?

MsgJp:
さっきマンドラゴラの姿を見た
あれはここで飼われているものか？
フィンダムで見るものとは違う姿をしていたようだが
MsgEn:
I saw the appearance of a Mandragora earlier. 
Is that one of the creatures kept here? 
It seemed to have a different appearance from 
what I usually see in Phindym.

MsgJp:
どうも“シェリーちゃん”なる魔物が
気にかかる
MsgEn: I can't help but be concerned about this "Shelly-chan" monster.

MsgJp:
貴様ほどの者が護る神殿に
そう何度も侵入を試みるとは
俺の想像を超える強力な魔物なのだろう
MsgEn:
For someone like you to repeatedly attempt
to infiltrate the temple I protect,
the creature "Shelly-chan" must be a powerful foe
beyond my imagination.

MsgJp:
白竜とも、精霊竜とも違う竜力を感じる
アッカーシェランの竜か？
それにしては――
MsgEn:
I can feel a dragon power different from both 
the White Dragon and the Spirit Dragon. 
Is this the Dragon Force of Acre Selund? 
But even so...

MsgJp:
毛玉――？
いや、布か
こういった感触の布は珍しい
ほう――こうして首に巻くのか――
MsgEn:
A furball?
No, it's a cloth.
It's rare to find a cloth with this kind of feel.
Oh, so this is how you wrap it around your neck...

MsgJp:
なるほど、これは暖かいな
この寒さになるレスタニアならではの物だろう
MsgEn:
I see, this is warm.
It must be something unique to Lestania, 
where it gets this cold.

MsgJp:
フィンダムに戻れば首を温める必要はない
庵を彩る飾りにはなりそうだが
MsgEn:
There is no need to warm your neck if back in 
Phindym.
It might become a decoration that adorns the 
hermitage.

MsgJp:
ふむ――
レスタニアに来るのはこれで何度目かになる
だが、貴様とこの地を歩いたことは無かったな
MsgEn:
Hmm...
This must be my umpteenth time coming to Lestania.
But I have never walked this land with you.

MsgJp:
この祭りが終わったら
神殿の外を少し見て回ろうと思っている
時間があれば、共に来るがいい
MsgEn:
After this festival,
I'm going to take a little look around 
outside the temple.
If you have time, come along.

MsgJp:
――レスタニアの魔物との戦いに
興味が湧いただけだ
ついでに、長稽古を付けてやる
腕がなまっていないかの確認としてな
MsgEn:
I was just interested in fighting the monsters 
of Lestania. 
As a bonus, I'll give you some intense training 
to make sure your skills haven't gotten rusty.

MsgJp:
ま、貰いっぱなしってのも
なんだからな
MsgEn:
Well, I can't just keep taking 
without giving anything in return.

MsgJp:
エリオットのやつが妙に
はりきっちまってよ
あいつ、意外と行動力あるみたいだぜ
MsgEn:
Elliot seems unusually energetic lately.
Surprisingly, he's quite proactive.

MsgJp:
ここに立つのも慣れたってわけじゃねぇが――
いや、慣れたのか、これは
MsgEn:
Standing here doesn't mean I'm used to it—
No, perhaps I have gotten used to it.

MsgJp:
こういうイベントごとってのも
刺激ではあるな
そう考えると、悪くはねぇ
MsgEn:
Events like this can be quite stimulating. 
When I think about it, it's not a bad thing.

MsgJp:
やたらとお前から欲しがってるやつらが
並んでるってのに、俺に渡していいのか？
――ま、ありがたく受け取っとくぜ
MsgEn:
There are so many people lining up to ask for this 
from you, are you sure you want to give it to me?
――Well, I'll gratefully accept it, then.

MsgJp:
もし、誰がお前から貰えるかって
賭けがあったら、俺は大穴だったろうな
MsgEn:
If there was a bet on who could receive something 
from you, I would have been a long shot.

MsgJp:
なんだ、思わせぶりだな
――別に欲しいわけじゃねえけどよ
MsgEn:
What, teasing me, huh?
—It's not like I want it or anything.

MsgJp:
あ？　お前、さっき別のやつに
渡してなかったか？
よくわからんが、一人にしか
渡せないルールなんだってよ
MsgEn:
Huh? Did you not give it to someone else earlier? 
I don't really understand, but apparently there's 
a rule that it can only be given to one person.

MsgJp:
ありがたく受け取っとくぜ
また作った時は俺んとこに持って来いよ
旅の最中に軽くつまむのに良さそうだからな
MsgEn:
I'll take that as a thank you.
If you make it again, bring it to me.
Looks like a good way to grab 
a quick bite while traveling.

MsgJp:
せっかくのお祭りです
楽しみましょう、隊長！
MsgEn:
It's a festival.
Let's have fun, Captain!

MsgJp:
俺たちからのお返し――
かなり悩んだんですけど、きっと隊長に
喜んでもらえるものになったはずです
MsgEn:
Our return gift to you, Captain...
I really struggled with it, but I'm sure it has 
become something that will make you happy.

MsgJp:
リズとメイリーフからのお返しは
何でしたか？
聞いてみたけど、教えてくれなかったんです
MsgEn:
What was the return gift from Lise and Mayleaf?
I asked, but they didn't tell me.

MsgJp:
チョコレートをたくさんの人から貰うと
お返しも大変になりますね
あ、でも、隊長へのお返しは特別ですよ！
MsgEn:
When you get chocolates from so many people,
it can be hard to give back.
Oh, but giving back to the captain is special!

MsgJp:
俺にくれるんですか？
ですよね！　嬉しいです！
MsgEn:
You're giving it to me?
Yes, right?　I'm so glad!

MsgJp:
これは隊長からの信頼が形になったものだと思うと
すぐに食べるのは勿体ないような――
少し飾ってから食べちゃダメですか？
MsgEn:
Thinking that this is something that represents 
the trust from the Captain,
it feels like a waste to eat it right away--
Is it not allowed to decorate it a little first?

MsgJp: 待ってる間、変に緊張してしまいました――
MsgEn: I got strangely nervous while waiting--

MsgJp:
次は俺にくれるって信じて待ってました！
――え、最初に渡した人にしか渡せないルールが！？
そ、そんな――
MsgEn:
I've been waiting, 
believing that you would give it to me next!
