- Eh, there's a rule that it can only be given to 
the person it was originally handed to!?
Th-That's...

MsgJp:
隊長、ありがとうございます！
信頼の証をこんなに――
じわじわと嬉しさが増していくようで
もう、何個でも欲しくなります
MsgEn:
Thank you so much, Captain!
So much proof of trust--
I'm slowly getting happier and happier,
I want more and more of them already!

MsgJp: やぁ、今日もにぎわってるね
MsgEn: Hey, it's busy today!

MsgJp:
まさか、またこのステージに
立つなんて――
まぁ、慣れたもんだよ
MsgEn:
I never thought I would stand on 
this stage again...
Well, I guess I've gotten used to it.

MsgJp:
決まった日に贈り物をもらって、それにお返しを
するっていうのも不思議なお祭りだよね
要するに、親密さを確かめ合ってるのかな
MsgEn:
Receiving gifts on a designated day and then 
returning them, it's such a strange festival, 
isn't it? 
In other words, 
it's like confirming our intimacy with each other.

MsgJp:
そういえば、前回のお祭りの時に
ジョゼフ様にチョコレートをあげてみたんだ
喜んでもらえたのは確かだと思うんだけど
なぜか未だに食べずに置いてあるんだよね
MsgEn:
By the way, 
I remember that during the last festival, 
I tried giving Master Joseph some chocolate. 
I'm pretty sure he was happy about it, 
but for some reason, 
he still hasn't eaten it, it's just sitting there.

MsgJp:
へぇ、いい香りだ――
それにすごく甘くておいしい！
確かに、これは珍しくて良いモノだね
ありがとう！
MsgEn:
Wow, it smells so good...
And it's incredibly sweet and delicious!
Indeed, this is something rare and wonderful.
Thank you!

MsgJp: どうしたんだい、ゴソゴソして
MsgEn: What's wrong? Why are you fidgeting?

MsgJp:
一度誰かにあげたら、他の人には
あげられないっていうルールらしいよ
――何か理由があるのかな
MsgEn:
I heard the rule is that once you give it to 
someone, you can't give it to anyone else.
--I wonder if there's a reason for that.

MsgJp:
またくれるのかい、ありがとう！
甘いものは結構好きなんだ
考え事をしている時や本を読む合間に食べると
いい気分転換になるからね
MsgEn:
Are you giving it to me again? Thank you! 
I actually quite like sweet things. 
When I'm thinking or in between reading books, 
eating them helps me feel refreshed.

MsgJp:
ふふ、またみんなで集まれて
嬉しいな
MsgEn:
Hehe, 
it's nice to be able to gather together 
with everyone again. I'm glad.

MsgJp:
お返し、リズと一緒に準備したの
何がいいかなって考えるの、とっても
楽しかったよ
MsgEn:
The return gift, I prepared it together with Lise.
I had a lot of fun thinking up what would be good.

MsgJp:
やっぱり、みんながニコニコしてると
幸せな気持ちになって
わたしもニコニコしちゃう
MsgEn:
After all, when everyone is smiling,
I can't help but feel happy too,
and I start smiling as well.

MsgJp:
この前のお祭りの時、わたしも
パメラと一緒にチョコを作ったの
ちゃんと上手にできたんだよ
MsgEn:
At the last festival, I also made chocolates with 
Pamela and we were really good at it!

MsgJp:
わたしがもらっていいの？
――ん、滑らかで濃厚！
すごい、こんなお菓子は初めて！
ありがとう、とっても美味しいよ
MsgEn:
Can I have some? 
Hmm, it's smooth and rich! 
Wow, I've never had a snack like this before! 
Thank you, it's really delicious!

MsgJp: どうしたの？　何か探し物？
MsgEn: What's wrong? Are you looking for something?

MsgJp:
《特製チョコレート》は誰か一人にしか
あげられないんだって
――八方美人はよくないからって
シェリーが言ってたよ
MsgEn:
I heard that the "Special Chocolate" can only 
be given to one person.
—Sherry said that being two-faced isn't good.

MsgJp:
わぁ、嬉しい！
ほんとはもっと欲しいなって思ってたの
美味しくて、さっきのはすぐ食べちゃった
MsgEn:
Wow, I'm so happy!
I was really hoping to get more.
They were so good, 
I ate the ones I had earlier right away!

MsgJp: 隊長、目いっぱい楽しんでる！？
MsgEn: Captain, are you enjoying yourself to the fullest?

MsgJp:
メイリーフと二人でお返しの準備したんだ
隊長のために一生懸命考えたからね！
MsgEn:
Mayleaf and I prepared the return gift together.
We thought very hard for the captain, you know!

MsgJp:
もしもこの前、隊長がここに立ってたら
きっと今頃レスタニア中の人に
“お返し”することになってたよね！
MsgEn:
If the captain had been standing here the other 
day, I'm sure they would be "giving back" to 
all of Lestania by now!

MsgJp:
二人一組でお返しを用意したんだけど
クラウスが一人になっちゃったんだよね
本人は気にしてないみたいだったけど――
ちゃんと用意できたか心配だよ
MsgEn:
We prepared the return gifts in pairs, 
but Klaus ended up being alone. 
He doesn't seem to mind, 
but I'm worried if we were able to 
prepare them properly.

MsgJp:
やった！　さすが隊長、見る目あるよね！
それじゃ、いただきまーす
――わ、美味しい！　とろける！
隊長はコレ、もう食べた？
MsgEn:
Yes! Well done, Captain! 
You really have a good eye! 
Alright then, let's dig in. 
-Oh, this is delicious! It's melting in my mouth! 
Captain, have you already tried this?

MsgJp: えー、何か貰えると思ったのにな～
MsgEn: Oh, I thought I would receive something...

MsgJp:
あ、隊長！
お祭りのルールで、八方美人はダメなんだって
うう――わたしとしては欲しいんだけど――
MsgEn:
Ah, Captain!
According to the festival rules, you can't have it all ways.
Ugh--I'd love to have it--but...

MsgJp:
ラッキー！　じゃなくて、ありがとう！
もっと食べたいと思ってたところだったんだ
隊長から貰ったものだと思うと
美味しさがさらに増すよ
MsgEn:
Lucky! No, thank you! 
I was just thinking that I wanted to eat more. 
When I think that it's something I received from 
the captain, the deliciousness increases!

MsgJp: 夏、楽しんでるかい？
MsgEn: Are you enjoying your summer?

MsgJp:
えっ、夏だっていうのにビーチに
行かない手があるっていうのか？！
――ありえない！
山は秋に行けばいいさ
MsgEn:
What?! 
Are you saying that there's no way we can go to 
the beach even though it's summer?! 
That's impossible! 
We can go to the mountains in autumn.

MsgJp:
ビーチで何をするのかって？
肌を焼いたり、水辺で遊んだり
陽の光を浴びながら友と語らったり
海の幸を楽しんだり――挙げきれないな！
MsgEn:
What do you do at the beach?
Well, you can sunbathe, play in the water,
have conversations with friends while basking in 
the sunlight, enjoy the bounty of the sea... 
the list goes on!

MsgJp:
ああ、水着を着ていても
水に触れるのは浅瀬だけにしておいた方がいい
この時期、ヒュージブルだけじゃなく
サメもいるから、さ
MsgEn:
Ah, even if you're wearing a swimsuit, it's 
better to only touch the water in the shallows.
During this season, there are not only the Brine,
but also sharks, so...

MsgJp:
どーお？
夏、輝いてるぅ？
MsgEn:
What's up?
Summer's shining, huh?

MsgJp:
夏のギラギラした太陽って素敵でしょ？
私たちもそれに負けないように
ビカビカに輝かなくっちゃね～
MsgEn:
Isn't the scorching summer sun wonderful?
We must also burn brightly,
so we won't be outshone~

MsgJp:
夏は一年のうちで今だけ！
そして、今年の夏は人生で一度きり
輝かないで終われる？
MsgEn:
Summer is only once in the year!
And this summer is only once in a lifetime.
Will you let it end without shining?

MsgJp:
いい感じの水着はすぐに試すことにしてるの
コレ、なかなかでしょぉ？
MsgEn:
I've made it a habit to try on nice 
swimsuits right away.
This one, isn't it quite nice?

MsgJp:
ここで話すのか？
いつ巨人が来るかわからない
手短に頼むよ
MsgEn:
Are we going to talk here?
I don't know when the Giants will come.
Please keep it brief.

MsgJp:
レスタニア区ローテス？
全く聞いたこともない地名だ
MsgEn:
Lestanian District Rotes?
I've never heard of that place at all.

MsgJp:
ここ、妙な臭いがしないか？
肌も少しべたべたするし――
空気に何か含まれてる気がするんだが
MsgEn:
Do you smell something strange here?
My skin feels a bit sticky...
I feel like there's something in the air.

MsgJp: 早く本隊に合流しないと――
MsgEn: If we don't join up with the main group soon--

MsgJp:
今回の催しは、遠方からも客人を招いているそうだ
万が一のことがあってはならん
いつでも動けるよう備えておかねばな
MsgEn:
It seems that this event has invited guests 
from afar.
We must be prepared in case anything 
unexpected happens.

MsgJp:
いつもと違う雰囲気に呑まれ
沖まで出ようとする者が出るやもしれん
事故が無いよう、見張っているのだ
MsgEn:
The unusual atmosphere may cause some of them 
to try to go out to sea.
We are on the lookout for accidents.

MsgJp:
この辺りの海岸は遠浅になっている
柵があるところまではヒュージブルも出ないが――
そら、沖を見てみろ
MsgEn:
The coastline around here becomes shallow. 
Until you reach the area with fences, 
there won't be any Brine, but... 
Look, try looking out to sea.

MsgJp:
柵を越えると
ヒュージブルだけでなく鮫もうろついている
貴殿も沖へは出ないことだ
MsgEn:
When crossing the fence, 
it's not only the Brine but also lurking sharks.
It is advised that you do not venture out to sea.

MsgJp:
しかし暑いな
おまけに日中は照り返しもある
――あとで一泳ぎしてくるとしよう
MsgEn:
But it's hot and the sun is shining.
--I'll go for a swim later!

MsgJp:
言うな――
ゲルト騎士団長の水着のセンスが
少し若々しいことくらい、何だというのだ
MsgEn:
Don't say that--
What's wrong with Commander Gerd's slightly 
youthful sense of style when 
it comes to swimsuits?

MsgJp:
あまりハメを外し過ぎないでくれ
柵や門の向こうは会場外だ
MsgEn:
Please don't go too wild and let loose too much.
Beyond the fence and gate is outside the venue.

MsgJp:
規則は規則だからな
越えようとするなら、例えあんたでも
引っ張り戻さないといけなくなる
MsgEn:
Rules are rules,
and if you try to cross them, even if it's you,
I'll have to pull you back.

MsgJp:
突然このビーチへの招待状が届いたんだ
――興味は無かったが、部下たちに
どうしても息抜きすべきだと主張されてな
MsgEn:
I got an invitation to this beach out of the blue.
-- I wasn't interested, but my guys insisted
that I should really take a break.

MsgJp:
ここには魔物も、ましてやオークもいない
一時的なものだが絵に描いたような平和だな
MsgEn:
There are no demons here, much less orcs.
It's temporary, but it's picture-perfect peace.

MsgJp:
だが、戦うわたしたちの
背後に何があるか、誰がいるか――
そんなものを再認識させてくれる
MsgEn:
But it reminds us of what lies behind us, 
of who stands with us, as we fight.

MsgJp:
わたしがここにいるのが珍しいか？
――まぁ、適当にすごして
すぐに戻るつもりだ
MsgEn:
Is it unusual for me to be here?
--Well, I'll just hang out and get back soon.

MsgJp:
ここはわたしの居場所ではない――
おまえも、本当はそう思っているのではないか？
MsgEn:
This is no place for me--
You really think so too, don't you?

MsgJp:
ふふ、その顔を見ればわかる
――また最前線で会おう
MsgEn:
Hehe, just by looking at that face, I can tell
―― Let's meet again on the front lines.

MsgJp:
俺も《黄金ヤシの繊維》を集めて
取引きに使おうかとも思ったが――
MsgEn:
I thought about collecting some 
"Golden Palm Fibers" too
and using them to make a deal, but--

MsgJp:
やめたよ
今日は休業だ
ひたすらのんびり過ごしてやろうと思ってね
MsgEn:
I quit.
Today is a day off.
I plan to spend it leisurely.

MsgJp:
せっかくのビーチだ
ポーンにも水着を選んでやるといい
MsgEn:
It's a rare opportunity to be at the beach. 
It would be nice to choose a swimsuit for 
the Pawns as well.

MsgJp:
――よかったら、コーネリアにも
会っていってくれ
なかなか良い色の水着が手に入ったんだ
MsgEn:
—If you'd like, please go meet Cornelia too.
I managed to get a really nice-colored swimsuit.

MsgJp:
ほらな
覚者になったって、楽しもうと思えば
いくらでも楽しめるんだ
MsgEn:
You see, even if you're an Arisen, 
you can have as much fun as you want, 
if you want to.

MsgJp:
リズ様、食べきれないほど大きなスイカで
スイカ割りをしたいとおっしゃっていて――
MsgEn:
Lady Lise has expressed her desire to play 
watermelon splitting with a watermelon that is 
so big she can't finish eating it.

MsgJp:
リズ様はやりたいことがたくさんおありのようで――
さっきからあちこちに目移りしていらっしゃるのです
MsgEn:
It seems that Lady Lise 
has many things she wants to do--
she has been looking around restlessly 
since earlier.

MsgJp:
リズ様も私も、海辺でこのように過ごすのは
初めてのことなのです
MsgEn:
Both Lady Lise and I have never spent time like 
this by the seaside before.

MsgJp:
夏ですね、覚者さま！
こんな風にビーチで遊べるなんて
思ってもみませんでした！
MsgEn:
It's summer, Master Arisen!
I never imagined we could have this much fun 
playing on the beach like this!

MsgJp:
水着を持っている人たちは
みなさんビーチに来られているみたいですよ
MsgEn:
It seems that everyone who has swimsuits
has come to the beach.

MsgJp:
え？　本日のニュースですか？
――えっと、今日は――
とっても良いお天気、素敵な夏です！
MsgEn:
Huh? Is it today's news?
Um, well, today is... 
such beautiful weather, a lovely summer!

MsgJp:
覚者よ、あなたも“サマーバケーション”か？
ファビオ様は
「サマーバケーションをエンジョイ」だそうだ
MsgEn:
Arisen, are you going on a "Summer Vacation" too? 
It seems that Master Fabio says to 
"Enjoy the Summer Vacation."

MsgJp:
この小さな服はファビオ様の
見立てによるものだ
ビーチへ行くことが
決まった時、突然手渡された
MsgEn:
This little outfit was fashioned by Lord Fabio.
When it was decided we were going to the beach,
it was suddenly handed to me.

MsgJp:
そして、こう言われた
「今回は髪を際立たせる色と
　繊細なレースがこだわりだ」と
MsgEn:
And they told me this:
"This time, the colors that highlight the hair and
the delicate lace are the focus."

MsgJp:
柵の外はビーチフェスティバルの会場ではない
出ようとする者へは声掛けをするようにと
言いつけられている
MsgEn:
Outside the fence is not part of the venue 
for the Beach Festival.
We have been instructed to call out to 
anyone trying to leave.

MsgJp:
わっ！？　な、なんだ、お前か――
こんなところで何してるんだ！
MsgEn: Oh! W-Whoa, it's you... What are you doing here?!

MsgJp:
俺か？　俺は――
ちょっと眩しくて、日陰に――
MsgEn:
Me?　I'm--
It's a little too bright, and I'm in the shade, so--

MsgJp:
うわっ！　お前、いたのか！
――お前、うかつに副隊長に近づこうと思うなよ
あの美しさで焼き焦がされるぞ
MsgEn:
Whoa! You're here!
-- Don't you dare approach the Vice Captain so 
carelessly.
You'll be charred by her beauty.

MsgJp:
海辺のヴァネッサ副隊長――
鮮烈に輝く太陽の女神のような美しさだ
MsgEn:
Vanessa, the Vice Captain of the Beach――
She possesses a beauty that shines brilliantly, 
like the goddess of the sun.

MsgJp:
ビーチの方でグレゴリーさんが
鑑定交換のお店を出してますよ！
どうも、海自体には興味がないみたいです
MsgEn:
Mr. Gregory has set up an Appraisal Exchange shop over 
by the beach! 
It seems like he isn't interested in the sea 
itself, though.

MsgJp:
セネカさんと遊びに来たんですけど
覚者さまたちを見ていたら
何かとご案内したい気持ちに――！
MsgEn:
I came to play with Seneka,
but as I watched the Arisen,
I felt a strong desire to guide them in some way...!

MsgJp:
あ、お手洗いなら
砂浜の奥の方にもありますよ
MsgEn:
Ah, if you're looking for a restroom,
there's one further back on the beach.

MsgJp:
ビーチを楽しむ装いは見つかりましたか？
水着としても使える装備を取り揃えてみました
どうぞ、見ていってくださいね！
MsgEn:
Have you found an outfit to enjoy the beach?
We have a selection of equipment that can also 
be used as swimwear.
Please take a look!

MsgJp:
照りつける日差し、透き通る海
それでは！　この夏を讃える一曲を――！
MsgEn:
The sun shining, the sea crystal clear.
Let's see!　A song to celebrate this summer...!

MsgJp:
るらら～
この歌は、真夏に輝く覚者さまのために～
MsgEn:
Lalala~
This song is for the Arisen who shines in the midst of summer~

MsgJp:
さて、本日も盛り上がってまいりました～
しかしまだまだ終わりません、さらに一曲――
MsgEn:
Now, 
we have once again reached a high point today~
But, it's not over yet. One more song to go――

MsgJp:
ふぅ、開けた空間で風を浴びるのも
気持ちがいいものね
MsgEn: Whew, it feels good to be in an open space with a breeze.

MsgJp:
あらぁ、日焼けを心配してくれるの？
いいのよ――魔術で焼けるのを防いでいるから
初歩的なことよ、ふふふ
MsgEn:
Oh, worried about my sunburn, are you?
It's fine―― I'm preventing it with magic.
Just a basic thing, hehehe.

MsgJp:
海と魔術も無関係じゃないのよ
潮力――その大きな力の法則を知ることは
世界そのものを覗き込む一歩に繋がるわ
MsgEn:
The sea and magic are not unrelated.
Tidal power--knowing the laws of that great force 
is one step toward looking into the world itself.

MsgJp:
ふふ――こんなところまで来て
お勉強も無粋かしら？
いいわ、遊んでいらっしゃい
MsgEn:
Hehe... To think you've come all the way here.
Is studying too dull for you?
Very well, then. Enjoy yourself.

MsgJp:
ビーチに招待してくれてありがとう
――あれ？
あの招待状、君からじゃなかったの？
MsgEn:
Thank you for inviting me to the beach.
- Wait, huh?
That invitation, it wasn't from you?

MsgJp:
波の音が心地いいね
研究の息抜きにちょうどいいわ
MsgEn:
The sound of the waves is soothing.
Just the thing to take a break from research.

MsgJp:
本当言うとね、来ようかどうしようか
ちょっと迷ってたの
MsgEn:
To tell you the truth, 
I wasn't sure if I should come or not.

MsgJp:
でも、来てよかったわ
こうして外の景色に触れることで視点を変えられる
帰ったら、何か新しい発見をできそう
MsgEn:
But, I'm glad I came. 
By experiencing the view outside, 
I can change my perspective. 
When I return, 
it seems like I'll be able to make 
some new discoveries.

MsgJp:
あんたも見てみろって！
高いとこから眺める海も最高だぜ！
MsgEn:
Why don't you take a look too!
The view of the sea from up high is the best!

MsgJp:
いや～、一番でっかい白竜像あるだろ？
あれに登りたかったんだけどさ
さすがに壊すとマズいから自重したってワケ
MsgEn:
Oh, the biggest White Dragon Statue, right? 
I wanted to climb on it, but well, I restrained 
myself since it would be bad to break it.

MsgJp:
修理が大変そうってのもあるけど
神殿の怖い人らがすっ飛んできそうだろ？
MsgEn:
I know it's a lot of work to fix it, but the 
scary people in the temple are going to come 
flying out of the woodwork, right?

MsgJp:
夏の岩山もいいけど、海もなかなかだな
果てしなく海と空が続いてる景色
“自由”を感じるよ
MsgEn:
The summer rocky mountains are nice, 
but the sea is also quite beautiful. 
The scenery where the endless sea and sky 
continue is a sight that makes me feel "free".

MsgJp: きゃっ！　平べったい魚！
MsgEn: Kya!　Flat fish!

MsgJp: メイリーフちゃん、そこにちっちゃな魚が！
MsgEn: Mayleaf, there's a little fish there!

MsgJp:
波がずっと続くの、面白くって！
お姉様、水に入るのも楽しいですよ！
MsgEn:
The waves go on forever, it's fun!
Sis, it's fun to get in the water too!

MsgJp:
あっ、覚者様
――こほん、ちょっとはしゃぎすぎたかしら
MsgEn:
Ah, Ser Arisen.
Ahem, perhaps I got a bit too carried away.

MsgJp:
美しい光景ですね――
わたしたち、海へはあまり行かないものですから
ディリスもすっかりはしゃいでいますわ
MsgEn:
It's a beautiful sight--
We don't go to the beach very often.
Dirith is totally excited too!

MsgJp:
ふふふ、覚者様もここで海の風を
楽しんでいかれませんか？
MsgEn:
Hehe, would you, Ser Arisen, 
like to enjoy the sea breeze here as well?

MsgJp:
ディリス、メイリーフさん
あまり深くへはいかないようにね
MsgEn:
Dirith, Ms. Mayleaf.
Please be careful not to go too deep.

MsgJp:
此度の招待に礼を言わねば――
ここの族長はどなたなのだろうか
MsgEn:
I must express my gratitude for this invitation—
I wonder who the chief of this clan is.

MsgJp:
美しいところだ
白竜の加護に、わたしも感謝しよう
MsgEn:
It's a beautiful place.
I too will thank the 
White Dragon for his blessings!

MsgJp:
レスタニアとは自由な国なのだな
この歳になって、目に映る全てが
新鮮に感じることなどそう無い――
MsgEn:
Lestania is indeed a country of freedom.
At my age, it's not every day that everything I 
see feels so fresh--
and it's not often that I feel that way.

MsgJp:
いつか――フィンダムにいる子供が
今のわたしのように、異国の景色を
その眼で見ることもあるのだろう
MsgEn:
Someday, the children in Phindym may also see 
foreign landscapes with their own eyes, 
just like I do now.

MsgJp:
この浜辺は様々な場所と繋げられているそうだな
その一つにモルフォールが選ばれたのは
そちらの族長の厚意なのだろう？
MsgEn:
This beach is said to be connected to many places.
Was it at the behest of your tribe's chief
that Morfaul was chosen as one of them?

MsgJp:
ああ、ミューセルとディリスのことか
ミューセルは元々モルフォールの出だ
MsgEn:
Oh, you mean Musel and Dirith.
Musel is originally from Morfaul.

MsgJp:
たまたまミューセルがディリスを伴って
モルフォールへ戻っているところへ
この催しの招待を受けたのでな
MsgEn:
It just so happened that Musel was returning to 
Morfaul with Dirith when he received the 
invitation for this event.

MsgJp:
色んなヤツが来てるみたいだぜ
お前の顔見て喜ぶヤツも多いんじゃねえか
行ってやれよ
MsgEn:
It seems like a lot of people are coming here, ye?
There are probably many people who would be happy 
just seeing your face.
Go and give it a try.

MsgJp:
おい、エリオットのヤツ
リラックスしすぎじゃねえか？
ビーチから帰ったらちゃんと元に戻るんだろうな
MsgEn:
Hey, Elliot's relaxing too much, isn't he?
I hope he's back to normal when he 
gets back from the beach.

MsgJp:
いつかキノザの近くに屋敷を
建ててやろうと思ってんだが――
ブリアの近くに別荘持つってのもいいかもな
MsgEn:
I'm thinking of someday building a mansion near 
Kinoza... or maybe having a villa near 
Breya could be nice too.

MsgJp:
リズがはしゃぎまわってんだ
スイカ割りだの何だのうるさいから
逃げてきたってわけよ、ったく――
MsgEn:
Lise is having a great time.
She was screaming about watermelon splitting and stuff.
So I ran away.

MsgJp:
隊長もいらしてたんですね！
いやあ、暑くてすぐに喉が渇きませんか？
果物も飲み物もたくさんありますよ
MsgEn:
Oh, the captain is here too! 
Well, don't you get thirsty quickly in this heat? 
There are plenty of fruits and drinks available.

MsgJp:
ジョゼフ様やクラウスは来なかったんで
お土産に写真を撮っていってあげようかと――
MsgEn:
Since Joseph and Klaus didn't show up,
I thought I'd take a picture as a souvenir--

MsgJp:
ステージや砂の白竜像なんかは
ばっちり撮ってきたんですけど
あの看板、どう思います？
MsgEn:
I've taken perfect shots of the stages and 
the White Dragon Statue made of sand, 
but what do you think about that sign?

MsgJp:
人が入るための空間がある看板を
それだけ撮って帰るっていうのは
やっぱりちょっとおかしいですよね――？
MsgEn:
A sign with space for people to enter.
It's strange to just take a picture of that and leave.
It is still a bit strange, right---?

MsgJp:
そういえば、リズにはもう会いましたか？
隊長とスイカ割りをするんだって
大騒ぎしてましたよ
MsgEn:
Speaking of which, have you met Lise yet?
She was making a big deal about splitting 
watermelons with the captain.

MsgJp:
はぁ～、ここには魔物もジョゼフ様もいないし
のんびりできていいなぁ
MsgEn:
Haah~ Here, there are no enemies or Master Joseph. 
It's nice to be able to relax.

MsgJp:
あっ、ほら――そこ、今キラッと光った！
こんなお魚初めて見たの！
MsgEn:
Ah, look! There, it just sparkled! 
I've never seen a fish like that before!

MsgJp:
パメラもね、覚者さんたちがたくさんいる
このビーチなら安心なんだって！
MsgEn:
Pamela says she feels safe on this beach
because there are lots of Arisen around!

MsgJp:
この水着、パメラが用意してくれたの
ひらっとしててかわいいんだよ
MsgEn:
Pamela got me this swimsuit.
It's so fluttery and cute.

MsgJp: ディリスちゃんと仲良くなれて、嬉しいな
MsgEn: I'm glad you and Dirith are getting along so well.

MsgJp:
ねぇ、もしかしてディリスちゃんって――
ううん、なんでもないの
MsgEn:
Hey, is it possible that Dirith is--
No, it's nothing.

MsgJp:
ねーっ、隊長！
海だよ！　海、海～！
そうだ、スイカ割りでもしない！？
MsgEn:
Hey, Captain!
It's the sea! The sea, the sea~!
Oh, I know! Shall we play watermelon smashing!?

MsgJp:
海に柵が立ってて、その中だったら
ヒュージブルも出ないんだって
隊長、みんなで泳ぎに行かない？
MsgEn:
There is a fence standing in the sea, 
and they say that the Brine won't come out 
if we're inside it. 
Captain, shall we all go for a swim?

MsgJp:
ああ、ビーチにいられる間に
やりたいことがいっぱいだよ
ビーチ限定のご飯も食べたいし――
MsgEn:
Oh, there's so much I want to do while 
I'm at the beach.
I'd love to try some beach-only food--

MsgJp:
たまには目いっぱい遊んでもいいよね！
普段がんばってるんだからさ～！
MsgEn:
Sometimes, 
it's okay to play to your heart's content! 
Because you're always working so hard~!

MsgJp:
これはこれは、覚者さん
暑いビーチですが
希少品、珍品の鑑定交換でしたらお任せを
MsgEn:
Well well, Ser Arisen.
It may be a hot beach,
but if it's appraisal exchange for rare and 
unique items, leave it to me.

MsgJp:
へっへへ――
海辺にも出張してまいりましたよ、ええ
鑑定交換に必要な目利き、嗅覚といえば
わたし以外におりませんからなぁ
MsgEn:
Hehehe――
I have also traveled to the seaside, yes.
When it comes to the keen eye and sense of smell 
required for appraisal exchange,
there is no one else but me.

MsgJp:
《黄金ヤシの繊維》――
今はそこら辺で採れますがね
いつか採れなくなると踏んでおりまして
へっへへ、その時に向けて収集しているのです
MsgEn:
Golden Palm Fiber - 
You can find it all over the place now, 
but you see, 
I anticipate that there will come a time when 
it can no longer be found. 
So, 
I am collecting it in preparation for that time. 
Hehehe.

MsgJp:
《黄金ヤシの繊維》はポーンには
加工できませんからな
ささ、わたしがそれに相応しき品と
鑑定交換してさしあげましょう
MsgEn:
The fibers of the golden palm cannot be
processed by pawns, so
I'll give you a suitable item
in exchange for an appraisal.

MsgJp:
よーっす、何かよくわからないけど
いらっしゃいませ～
MsgEn:
Hey there, 
I don't really understand what's going on, 
but welcome~~!

MsgJp:
なぁなぁ――どう、この服？
どう見ても魔物っぽくないか？
それもかなり強そうなヤツ
MsgEn:
Hey, hey - what do you think of this outfit?
It looks like a demon, doesn't it?
And a very strong one at that.

MsgJp:
やっぱ「ウオーー」とか「ガオーー」とか
言ってなりきっといた方がいいのかなぁ
これで金貰ってる訳だしなぁ
MsgEn:
I wonder if it's better to pretend and say things 
like "Woarrhhh" or "Roarrr" after all.
I mean, I am getting paid for this, so...

MsgJp:
オーナーが何やるために俺らを雇ってんのかも
さっぱりわかんないんだけどさ
とりあえず楽な仕事だよ
MsgEn:
I don't really understand why the owner hired us.
But for now, it's an easy job.

MsgJp:
多分、俺らを使って人をたくさん集めたところで
何かパーッと売り出すとか――
そういうつもりなんじゃないかな
MsgEn:
Perhaps, they're planning to use 
us to gather a lot of people
and then suddenly launch something big...

MsgJp:
二人一緒に働けるってことで
マリサが大喜びしてさ
こんなことで喜ばれるなんて不思議な気分だよ
MsgEn:
Marisa was overjoyed that we could work together. 
It feels strange to be praised 
for something like this.

MsgJp: は～い、いらっしゃいませ！
MsgEn: Yes, welcome!

MsgJp:
こうしてルキーノと一緒に働くのって
新鮮というかさ、嬉しいんだよね
MsgEn:
Working with Luchino in this way is
refreshing, or rather, a pleasure!

MsgJp:
ルキーノもああ見えて楽しそうだしね
ほんと、雇ってくれたオーナーに感謝だよ！
MsgEn:
And Luchino looks like he's having fun too.
I really appreciate the owner for hiring me!

MsgJp:
――まぁ、オーナーはこの酒場の人じゃないらしいし
怖い仮装して一度も脱がないしで
怪しいのは怪しいんだけど
MsgEn:
Well, 
it seems they aren't actually from this tavern, 
and they never take off their scary costume,
so they're definitely suspicious.

MsgJp:
この服、よくできてるよね～
サイズもあたしにぴったりだし
貰えちゃったりしないかなぁ
MsgEn:
This outfit is really well made, huh~
It fits me perfectly.
I wonder if I could have it...

MsgJp:
ルキーノはおばけみたいな格好してるんだ
これが思ったより似合っちゃって！
せっかくだから見ていってあげてよ
MsgEn:
Luchino is dressed like a ghost,
and surprisingly, it suits him!
Since he's gone to the trouble, 
why not take a look?

MsgJp:
ヒヒヒ――ハハハ――
ン？　何ダ、イタノカ
MsgEn:
Hehehe—hahaha—
Hm? What, something wrong?

MsgJp:
何ヲシテイタカ、ダト？
――聞イテタノカ
ソノ――ソレッポイ笑イ方ノ練習ダ
MsgEn:
"What were you doing", eh?
—You heard me.
I'm practicing that—err, that kind of smile.

MsgJp:
ココデ“良イ働キ”ヲスレバ
俺ノ株モ、上ガリ放題ダ！
MsgEn:
If I do good work here,
my stock will skyrocket!

MsgJp:
脳無シモンスターバカリ
連レテ来タノハ失敗ダッタ――
MsgEn:
Bringing in brainless monsters
turned out to be a failure――

MsgJp:
ソモソモ、アイツラノ面倒ヲ見ルダケデ
結構疲レルンダヨナ
MsgEn:
I'm just watching over those guys, 
so it's quite tiring, you know.

MsgJp:
オオ――コンナニタクサン
感謝スルゾ
MsgEn:
Wow! So much!
I'm so grateful!

MsgJp:
トコロデ、一体ドコカラ集メテクルンダ？
アレダケアンデッドヲ操ッテ探シテモ
見ツカラナカッタノニ――
地面ニデモ埋マッテイルノカ？
MsgEn:
So, where exactly are you gathering them from?
Even though I controlled the undead and searched,
I couldn't find them anywhere—
Are they buried in the ground or something?

MsgJp:
ナンダ！
期待サセヤガッテ！
MsgEn:
What!
You got my hopes up!

MsgJp:
早速集メテ来タンダナ！
ヨシヨシ、褒メテヤルゾ
MsgEn:
You gathered them so quickly!
Good job, I'll give you praise.

MsgJp:
ダガ――コンナモノデハ、マダマダ足リナイ
モットモット集メマクルノダ！
MsgEn:
But—this isn't enough yet,
we need to gather many more!

MsgJp:
《禍魂の晶石》ヲ
集メレバ集メルホド“良イモノ”ヲヤルゾ！
俺ハナ、コウ見エテ太ッ腹ナノダ
MsgEn:
Gather more and more of the "Gem of Devastation" 
and I'll give you something "really good"!
I'm a lot more generous than I look, you know.

MsgJp:
さぁさぁ、愛のお祭りの季節が来たぞ
もちろん俺も愛に溢れているとも！
MsgEn:
Come, come, 
the season of the Festival of Love has come!
Of course, I am overflowing with love too!

MsgJp:
フッフッフ――
今回の俺は一味違うのだよ
ほら、大人の余裕とかそういうのが
ダダ漏れだろう？
MsgEn:
Hehehe... 
This time, I'm a little different, you see.
Look, my mature composure and all that,
it's overflowing, isn't it?

MsgJp:
そう！　俺は！
一カ月以上前からシェリーちゃんに
「バレンタインは期待しててね」と
言われているのだッ！！
MsgEn:
Yes! 
I have been told by Ms. Shelly for over a month 
now, "Look forward to Valentine's Day!"

MsgJp:
シェリーちゃんがあの衣装を
とびきり気に入っているらしい
いやぁ、用意したかいがあるというものだね！
MsgEn:
It seems that Ms. Shelly truly loves that outfit. 
Oh, the effort was definitely worth it!

MsgJp:
ああいうフワッとしたスカートは
着ている人をハッピーにするのだそうだよ
――俺も試してみようかなぁ
MsgEn:
Fluffy skirts like that
make the wearer happy.
--I think I'll give it a try too!

MsgJp:
個人的には！
一年で一番アツい季節といっても
言い過ぎではないと思う！
いや違う、水着の方じゃなくてだね
MsgEn:
Personally!
I don't think it's an exaggeration to say
that it's the hottest season of the year!
No, wait, I didn't mean the swimsuit part.

MsgJp:
バレンタイン――素敵な響き！
今年も盛り上がっていきましょう！
MsgEn:
Valentine's Day - a wonderful sound! 
Let's make it exciting again this year!

MsgJp:
心躍るふんわりミディアム丈のスカート――
ついついくるっと回ってみたくなっちゃう
MsgEn:
A fluffy, medium-length skirt that will make your heart skip a beat--
You'll want to spin around and around!

MsgJp:
もちろん、キュートさと
セクシーさを兼ね備えたミニスカートも大好きよ！
いつかは優雅にロングスカートも
着こなしてみたいところね！
MsgEn:
Of course, I absolutely love mini skirts that 
combine cuteness and sexiness! 
Someday, I'd like to try wearing a long skirt and 
exude elegance as well!

MsgJp:
プレゼントを選んでいる時って幸せよね
一生懸命相手のことを考えているうちに
自分の方がワクワクしてくるんだもの
つい色んな趣向を凝らしてみたくなったり――
MsgEn:
Choosing presents is such a joy, isn't it?
As you earnestly consider the other person,
you find yourself getting excited too,
and you can't help but want to try various ideas—

MsgJp:
毎年甘いものじゃ飽きがくるかと思って
今年は方向性を変えてみたわ！
――もしかして、チョコレートを期待してたかしら
MsgEn:
Thinking that I'd get tired of the same old 
sweets every year, 
I decided to change things up this time!
--Were you expecting chocolate, by any chance?

MsgJp:
ここが白竜神殿――
貴様が仕える竜のための場か
MsgEn:
This is the White Dragon Temple--
a place for the dragon you serve.

MsgJp:
それにしても、広い集会場だ
日常的にこれだけの人数が集うとなれば
魔物からの防衛、病の流行――
困難も多かろう
MsgEn:
Still, it's a big meeting place.
When so many people gather there on a daily basis;
defense against demons, disease outbreaks--
there must be a lot of challenges!

MsgJp:
レスタニアでは他の部族の者にも
気軽に声をかけるのだな
――さっきからよく物を貰う
MsgEn:
It seems like it's common in Lestania to casually 
approach people from other tribes.
--I've been receiving a lot of gifts lately.

MsgJp:
そこの男に
“シェリーちゃん”とやらの視界には
入らないようにと言われた
MsgEn:
That guy over there told me not to get into the 
sight of someone named "Ms. Shelly."

MsgJp:
そもそも、“シェリーちゃん”とは何者だ
よほど凶暴な魔物でも徘徊しているのか？
手を焼いているようであれば
俺が討伐に出てやってもいいのだが
MsgEn:
Who is this "Ms. Shelly" to begin with?
Is there some kind of ferocious demon roaming the 
streets?
If you're having trouble with her,
I'd be happy to go out and take her down.

MsgJp:
ほう、それが“贈り物”か――
ずいぶん大切に運んできたものだ
これは相応の態度で受け取らねばなるまい
MsgEn:
Ah, so that's what this 'gift' is all about.
You must have put a lot of effort into 
carrying it here.
I suppose I should accept it with the 
proper gratitude.

MsgJp:
――この“贈り物”、特別なものであるらしいな
貴様がどういった基準で贈る相手を
選んでいるのかはわからんが
俺を選んだこと、後悔はさせん
MsgEn:
This "gift" seems to be something special.
I don't know by what criteria you choose
the recipients, but choosing me, 
you won't regret it.

MsgJp:
いつの日か、ダナの戦士――そして
誇り高きスピリットランサーとして
それを示そう
MsgEn:
Someday, as a warrior of Dana,
and as a proud Spirit Lancer,
I will demonstrate that.

MsgJp: 用があって声をかけたのではないのか
MsgEn: I presumed you had a motive for addressing me.

MsgJp:
「“一人だけ”に“一つだけ”」と聞いたが？
弟子に規律を破らせるわけにはいかん
その心遣いのみ受け取っておく
大人しくしていろ
MsgEn:
I heard 'only one person' and 'only one thing'?
I can't let my disciples break the rules.
I'll just accept their thoughtfulness.
Please behave yourself.

MsgJp:
ああ、いや――
騎士団の代表としてこの場にいると思って
気を引き締めねば
MsgEn:
Ah, no――
I must tighten my focus
as the representative of the Knights.

MsgJp:
それにしても、こういった祭りならば
もっと若手の騎士を呼んだ方が
良かったんじゃないだろうか
MsgEn:
Still, for a festival like this,
it would have been better
to invite more young knights!

MsgJp:
しかし、今回はとうとう騎士団にも声がかかったか
日頃から静かに抗議していたかいがあった
MsgEn:
But this time, the Knights have 
finally been called upon.
I suppose my persistent, 
silent protests have paid off.

MsgJp:
ゲルト騎士団長は妻帯しているからな
それで俺が呼ばれたのかもしれん
MsgEn:
Gerd, the Knight Commander, 
may have called me because he is married.

MsgJp:
――俺に？
いや、待ってくれ
もちろん有難く受け取らせてもらう！
だが、本当にあんたから貰えるとは
MsgEn:
-- for me?
No, wait.
Of course I'll take it gratefully!
But I never thought I'd actually get it from you.

MsgJp:
つくづく変わった覚者だな
まぁ、そういう変わった覚者だからこそ
俺もゲルト団長もあんたを認めてるんだが
MsgEn:
You're truly an unusual Arisen.
Well, it's because you're such an unusual Arisen
that both Captain Gerd and I acknowledge you.

MsgJp:
騎士団員の中には頑固な覚者嫌いもいるが
数は減ってきている――
そうだな、このケーキは詰所に持って帰って
若手たちにも見せてやるとしよう
MsgEn:
Among the members of the knight order, there are 
some who strongly dislike the Arisen, 
but their numbers are decreasing. 
Well then, I'll bring this cake back to the base 
and show it to the younger members as well.

MsgJp:
――なんだ
変に緊張したじゃないか
MsgEn:
I'm--what the--
You're making me weirdly nervous.

MsgJp:
おっと、規則を忘れたわけじゃないだろう
あんたが贈り物を渡せるのは
“一人にだけ”そして“一つだけ”だ
残念だけどな
MsgEn:
Oops, I hope you didn't forget the rule. 
You can only give a gift to "one person" 
and only "one" gift. Too bad.

MsgJp: やあ、にぎやかだね
MsgEn: Oh, hello! It's certainly buzzing with activity today.

MsgJp:
この人々がざわめく感じ
目を閉じていても感じる温かな気配――
久しぶりなものでね
MsgEn:
The feeling of these people bustling about,
I can sense it even with my eyes closed -
It's been a while, hasn't it?

MsgJp:
せっかくだから、リングディールにも
何かお土産を持って帰りたいな
MsgEn:
Since we're here, 
I'd like to bring something back to Ringdeel.

MsgJp:
神殿はいつもこんな感じなのかい？
それとも、今日は特別？
MsgEn:
Is the temple always like this?
Or is today special?

MsgJp:
これがチョコレートケーキか――
ありがとう、とても鮮烈な香りだ
ディナンに持って帰って
落ち着いて食べることにするよ
MsgEn:
Is this a chocolate cake? 
Thank you, it has a very pleasant scent. 
I'll take it back to Deenan and enjoy it calmly.

MsgJp:
うん、リングディールへのお土産も
何かお菓子にすることにしよう
だって、これには君の気持ちがこもってるんだろう？
それなら、僕だけが大切にいただかないとね
MsgEn:
Yeah, for souvenirs for Ringdeel,
let's make it some sweets.
After all, your feelings are in this, right?
Then, it's only right that I cherish them.

MsgJp:
――君も毎日忙しいとは思うけど
息抜きがしたくなったら森に来てくれ
いつでも歓迎するよ
MsgEn:
- I know you're busy every day, 
but if you feel like taking a break, 
come to the forest. 
I'll welcome you anytime.

MsgJp:
様子がおかしいけど
どうかしたのかい？
MsgEn:
You're acting weird.
What's wrong?

MsgJp:
ううん、できたら貰って帰りたいところだけど――
君が人に贈ることができるのは
“一人だけ”に“一つだけ”なんだろう？
MsgEn:
No, I'd take it home if I could, but--
you can only give "one" to "one person", right?

MsgJp: こんにちは、隊長さん
MsgEn: Hello, Captain.

MsgJp:
お招きいただきありがとうございます
ここに来られて、本当に嬉しいです
勉強にも、息抜きにもなります――
そう、ジョゼフ神官にもお伝えください
MsgEn:
Thank you so much for having me,
I'm so glad to be here.
It's a great way to learn and relax--
Yes, please convey my message to Priest Joseph!

MsgJp:
皆笑顔で――居心地がいいですね
僕が幼かった頃のことを思い出します
MsgEn:
Everyone is smiling--it's cozy.
Reminds me of when I was a little girl!

MsgJp:
なんだかこの辺り、甘い香りが――？
あっ、すみません
不作法なことを――
MsgEn:
Hmm, 
there seems to be a sweet fragrance around here. 
Oh, I'm sorry for being rude--

MsgJp:
わぁ、ありがとうございます！
これは――そっと持たないと
潰してしまいそうなお菓子ですね
MsgEn:
Wow, thank you!
This is--I'll have to hold it gently
or I'm sure I'll crush this!

MsgJp:
さっき、壇上の女性から
「今日貰えるチョコレートケーキは
　とっても特別な、ただ一つの物」
と聞きました
MsgEn:
Earlier, from the woman on the stage, I heard, 
"The chocolate cake you can receive today is a 
very special, one-of-a-kind thing."

MsgJp:
隊長さんの特別なケーキ――
僕にとっても、特別です
家族や臣下たち以外から、こうして
贈り物をもらうのは初めてなんです
MsgEn:
The captain's special cake--
is special to me, too.
This is the first time I've received a gift like 
this from someone other than my family 
and my subjects!

MsgJp:
あの――隊長さん？
どうしたんですか？
MsgEn:
Um--Captain?
What's going on?

MsgJp:
“一人だけ”に“一つだけ”が
この催しのルールだと聞きました
異国から来たとはいえ、僕だけが
それを破るわけにはいきません
MsgEn:
I heard that "only one person" and 
"only one thing" are the rules of this event.
Even though I come from a foreign land, 
I cannot break that rule.

MsgJp: ふむ、盛り上がっているようだな
MsgEn: Hmm, it seems like things are getting exciting.

MsgJp:
酒場で一体どんな武具を鍛えるのかと
少し身構えてきたのだが――
杞憂で良かった
MsgEn:
I was a little on guard, wondering what kind of 
equipment they would forge at the tavern... 
but it seems I was worrying for nothing.

MsgJp:
俺は武具の力を引き出すことはできても
実は料理は――特に菓子なんかは――
自信を持って人に食べさせられる腕ではないのだ
MsgEn:
While I can unleash the power of weapons,
I must admit that when it comes to cooking,
especially making sweets,
I lack the confidence to serve them to others.

MsgJp:
いや、ここでこうして
辺りを見渡しているだけでも
楽しいものだ
MsgEn:
No, just being here, 
looking around is enjoyable.

MsgJp:
なんだ、見目の良い男が揃っているのに
わざわざオレに渡しにくるのか！
MsgEn:
Hold on a second. 
Why are you giving these to me? 
There are much better-looking guys here!

MsgJp:
ハハハ、お前は見る目があるな！
武具も見た目と性能、どちらを
気に入って使うかは各々の使い手次第
MsgEn:
Hahaha, you've got a good eye! 
Whether it's the appearance or the performance of 
equipment, it's up to each individual user to 
decide what they like and use.

MsgJp:
ちなみに、オレも見た目より性能を
磨き上げた方が好みだ
――人でいうと、いわゆる“中身”だな
MsgEn:
By the way, 
I also prefer to polish the performance
rather than the appearance
-- what people call "substance".

MsgJp:
このケーキ、工房での休憩のための
楽しみとしてとっておこう
今日は良い武具を鍛えられそうだ
うむ、実に励みになる！
MsgEn:
Let's save this cake for a break at the workshop,
as a pleasure to look forward to.
Today seems like a good day to forge 
some fine armor.
Yes, indeed, it's truly motivating!

MsgJp:
よしよし、よく考えてから
また来るといい
MsgEn:
Alright, take your time to think about it 
and come back later.

MsgJp:
おっと、今取り出そうとしたケーキは
自分用だな？　そうだろう？
何せルールとして“一人だけ”に“一つだけ”と
決まっているらしいからな、うむ
MsgEn:
Whoops, the cake I was about to take
is for me, right? That's the case?
After all, the rule is apparently 
"one for each person" and "only one," right? Hmm.

MsgJp: どうした、何か言いたいことがあるのか
MsgEn: What's the matter, you got something to say?

MsgJp:
恋に愛、か――
そういった話が特に好きなやつを
何人か知ってるよ
いや、“知っていた”か
MsgEn:
Love and affection, romance,
I know a few people who particularly
like stories like that.
Well, or rather, I "knew" them.

MsgJp:
神殿が浮足立っているな
考えようによっては、今ここにいるのは
防衛の観点から見ても良いことかもしれない
MsgEn:
The temple seems to be in a flurry.
Depending on how you look at it,
it might actually be a good thing 
from a defense standpoint.

MsgJp:
ジョゼフがこういったことを
許可するようになるとはね
いや、活気が出るのはいいことだと思う
MsgEn:
I didn't know Joseph would allow this kind of thing.
No, I think it's good to see some vibrancy.

MsgJp:
ふふ、そうか
何やら迷っている様子だったが
わたしに贈ることに決めたのか
それでは、ありがたく受け取ろう
MsgEn:
Hehe, I see.
You seemed to be hesitating about something,
but have you decided to give it to me?
Well then, I will gratefully accept it.

MsgJp:
だからといってひいきして
やるわけにはいかないが――
また、戦場で会うのを楽しみにしている
MsgEn:
That doesn't mean I'll show favoritism, though――
Besides, I'm looking forward to seeing you on 
the battlefield again

MsgJp:
先陣を切って剣を振るい
敵のただなかへ突入する時――
おまえと共に駆け抜けられればいいと思う
MsgEn:
As I lead the way and swing my sword
into the midst of the enemy--
I hope I can charge through with you.

MsgJp:
妙な顔をしているな
言いたいことがあるならさっさと言え
MsgEn:
You have a strange expression on your face.
If you have something to say, say it quickly.

MsgJp:
――待て、この催しにはルールがあっただろう
そのケーキ、わたしはもう受け取れないはずだ
MsgEn:
--Wait, there were rules to this event.
I'm not supposed to accept that cake anymore!

MsgJp: ああ、隊長か――うん、なに？
MsgEn: Ah, Captain-- Hmm, what is it?

MsgJp:
ジョゼフ神官――だっけ？
ネド王子の勉強のためにって
色々と取り計らってくれたらしいけど
それって本心かな
MsgEn:
Joseph, the priest... 
I heard he went out of his way to help 
Prince Nedo with his studies. 
I wonder if that was his true intention.

MsgJp:
別に、こういう遊び？　祭り？
みたいなものが嫌いなわけじゃない
ただ――あまり慣れないだけ
これでも楽しんでるよ
MsgEn:
Nothing. These games?　Festivals?
It's not that I don't like these things.
I just--I'm not used to them.
I'm still enjoying it.

MsgJp:
なんだかいい香りがするね
香ばしいような、濃厚なような――
MsgEn:
It somehow has a nice scent, doesn't it?
Like a fragrant, rich aroma...

MsgJp:
隊長――意外とキザなことするんだね
“一人だけに、一つだけ”をわたしに、なんて
MsgEn:
Captain――You surprisingly do some 
pretty sophisticated things.
Like saying 
"Only one thing for one person" to me.

MsgJp:
――ありがとう
さっきはああ言ったけど
本当にくれるだなんて、思ってもみなかった
MsgEn:
-Thank you.
I didn't expect you to really give it to me
after saying that earlier.

MsgJp:
今回はネド王子の付き添いのつもりで来たから
えーと、自分が何か貰うなんて
本当に予想外で――とにかく、ありがとう
MsgEn:
This time, 
I came intending to accompany Prince Nedo,
so, to receive something 
myself is truly unexpected - 
anyway, thank you very much.

MsgJp:
ふふ、来てみてよかったよ
このケーキ――大切に食べるから
MsgEn:
Hehe, I'm glad I came.
I'll cherish this cake and savor every bite.

MsgJp: ん？　何か用があったんじゃないの？
MsgEn: Hmm? Did you need something?

MsgJp:
このケーキ、渡せるのは
“一人だけに、一つだけ”って聞いたけど？
もし余っちゃったんなら
自分で食べてもいいんじゃないかな
MsgEn:
This cake, I'm told you can only give it to
"Only one, to one"?
If you've got some left over,
you can eat it yourself.

MsgJp: さっきからワクワクが止まらないよ！
MsgEn: I can't stop feeling excited since earlier!

MsgJp:
酒場にテラスがあるって素敵！
外の風を感じながら食べたり
飲んだりできたら、いい気分転換になるよね
MsgEn:
Having a terrace at a tavern is wonderful! 
It would be a nice change of mood to be able to 
eat and drink while feeling the breeze outside.

MsgJp:
あとでここのメニューを見せて
もらわなくちゃ！
珍しい料理があったら
自分でも作ってみたいもん
MsgEn:
I'll have to ask you to 
show me the menu here later!
If there are any interesting dishes, 
I'd like to try making them myself.

MsgJp:
ねぇねぇ、ここでいつも
どんな過ごし方をしてるの？
――そこにいる吟遊詩人の歌を聞きながら
皆で踊ったりするの？
MsgEn:
Hey, hey, what do you usually do here?
--Do you listen to the bard there
and dance with the others?

MsgJp:
ほ、ほんとにアタシにくれるの！？
誰か一人にしかあげられないんでしょ？
――嬉しい！！　すっごく嬉しいよ！
MsgEn:
W-Wait, are you really giving it to me!? 
You can only give it to one person, right? 
I'm so happy!! I'm incredibly happy!

MsgJp:
今、ちょっとだけ味見してもいい？
――あっ、表面はとろけて
中見はずっしりまったりしてる！
贅沢な材料で作りましたって感じ
MsgEn:
Now, can I have a little taste?
Oh, the surface is melting
and the inside is rich and dense!
It feels like it was made with luxurious ingredients.

MsgJp:
これは良いお茶と一緒に
味わって食べないと勿体ないヤツだね！
美味しいお菓子をありがとう！
MsgEn:
This is a waste if you don't eat
and savor it with good tea!
Thank you for the delicious sweets!

MsgJp:
んー、何だろな～
気になるなぁ
MsgEn:
Hmmm... I wonder what it is...
I'm curious.

MsgJp:
あっ、待って待って！
“一人”に“一回だけ”がルールなんでしょ？
こういうのってルールちゃんと守らないと
楽しさが半減しちゃうからさ、ね？
MsgEn:
Wait, wait! 
Isn't the rule "one person, one time"? 
If we don't follow the rules properly, 
the fun will be cut in half, you know?

MsgJp:
はい、覚者様――
まさか酒場でお会いすることになるとは
MsgEn:
Yes, Ser Arisen - 
I never expected to meet you in a tavern.

MsgJp:
普段は港洞におりますので
酒場での催しには詳しくないのです
本当に、こうして座っているだけで
よろしいのでしょうか？
MsgEn:
I'm usually in Cave Harbor, 
so I'm not familiar with the tavern events.
Are you sure you don't mind if I 
just sit here like this?

MsgJp:
どうして私がお招きいただけたのか
よくわかりませんが――
MsgEn: I don't understand why I was invited, but...

MsgJp:
そちらにいらっしゃる旅の女性と
目が合った瞬間、ぜひにと頼まれたのです
MsgEn:
The travelling lady over there.
As soon as our eyes met, she asked me to come.

MsgJp:
ここにこうして座っていると
楽しげな皆様を見ていられます
――時の流れも忘れてしまいそうです
MsgEn:
Sitting here like this,
watching all of you having so much fun
--I seem to forget the passage of time!

MsgJp:
まぁ――
これを私に――？
このような贈り物をいただけるとは
思ってもみないことで――
MsgEn:
Well...
Is this for me...?
I never expected to receive
a gift like this...

MsgJp:
ありがとうございます、覚者様
これからも貴方様の旅路が
より良きものとなるよう
微力ながらもお手伝いさせていただきます
MsgEn:
Thank you, Ser Arisen.
I will continue to help you in any way I can to 
make your journey even better!

MsgJp:
ああ、このくらいしか言えないとは
私もまだまだですね――
もどかしいとは、こういった
気持ちをさすのでしょうか
MsgEn:
Ah, that's about all I can say.
I still have a long way to go too—
Is this what they mean by frustration,
to feel like this?

MsgJp:
――？
どうなさったのですか？
MsgEn:
--?
What's going on?

MsgJp:
覚者様、ありがとうございます
しかし、今回の催しでは
“一人”に“一度”が規則とのこと――
MsgEn:
Ser Arisen, thank you very much.
However, in this event,
it seems that "one person" can only 
participate "once" -

MsgJp:
あらぁ、声をかけてくれるのね
どういうお祭りなのか、わかっていて？
MsgEn:
Oh my, you're calling out to me.
You know what kind of festival this is?

MsgJp:
聞いたわ
“恋と愛のお祭り”なんですって？
可愛いことを考えつくものね
MsgEn:
I heard it's a "festival of love and romance"?
That's a cute idea.

MsgJp:
“恋と愛”――
魔術をそのために使おうとする輩も
もちろんいるわ
でも、それって無粋の極みよ
MsgEn:
"Love and affection"--
There are, of course, 
those who use magic for that purpose.
But that is the height of tastelessness.

MsgJp:
それで、あたくしの小鳥さんは
一体誰に愛の歌を捧げるつもりなの？
MsgEn:
So, to whom does my little bird
intend to dedicate their song of love?

MsgJp:
ああ、素敵な香り
嬉しいわ、このケーキは今
あたくしのためだけに香っている――
MsgEn:
Ah, what a delightful aroma! 
I'm so pleased that this cake is wafting its 
fragrance just for me now.

MsgJp:
あなたがケーキにこめた想い――
後でじっくりといただくことにするわ
香りも見た目も、全て独り占めにして、ね
MsgEn:
The feelings you put into the cake -
I'll savor them later, all to myself,
the aroma, the appearance, everything.

MsgJp:
ふふ、でも、そう――
あなた自身になら、ほんの少し
分けてあげてもいいわ
ご褒美としてね
MsgEn:
Hehe, but yes--
If it's for you yourself,
I can give you
just a little bit as a reward.

MsgJp:
ふふふ――
そんな駆け引き、どこで覚えてきたのかしら？
MsgEn:
Hehehe...
Where did I learn such tactics?

MsgJp:
――大事なことを忘れているようね
想いを伝えるのは一人に一度きり
あなたもその覚悟で託したはずよ？
MsgEn:
You seem to have forgotten something important.
To convey your feelings, you only have one chance.
You must have entrusted it 
with that resolution, too, right?

MsgJp:
覚者さんじゃない！
調子はどう？
MsgEn:
Oh, if it's not Ser Arisen!
How are you doing?

MsgJp:
なぁに？　あたしよ、シェリーよ！
――いつもと少し雰囲気が違う？
もう！　照れちゃうからやめてよ
MsgEn:
What is it? It's me, Shelly!
- Is there something different about me today?
Oh, stop it! I get embarrassed when you say that.

MsgJp:
アンジェロがね、今年はどうしても
自分だけ先に神殿に向かうって言って――
MsgEn:
Angelo, you see, this year he just had to insist
on going ahead to the temple by himself...

MsgJp:
何かたくらんでるのがバレバレよねぇ
ふふふ、ホント不器用なんだから
MsgEn:
It's so obvious that you're up to something,
isn't it?
Hehehe, you're really clumsy, you know.

MsgJp:
今日はね、とっておきのドレスを着てきたの
髪型も――どう、レディに見える？
MsgEn:
Today, you know, I came dressed in my finest
dress.
Even my hairstyle... How do I look, like a lady?

MsgJp:
今日は、その！
君に力を貸してほしくてだな――
MsgEn:
Today is the day! I want you to lend me your
strength.

MsgJp:
どうだね、この衣装は？
自分なりにあれこれ組み合わせて
イイ感じに見えるよう頑張ってみたのだが
MsgEn:
How about this outfit? I did my best to combine
various elements and make it look good.

MsgJp:
シェリーちゃんは
後から来ることになってるんだ
きっとおめかししてきてくれるはずだ！
MsgEn:
Ms. Shelly is supposed to come later. I'm sure
she'll come dressed up!

MsgJp:
いや、あの、神殿のホワイトデーを
盛り上げるために来たんだ
それは間違いないぞ！
MsgEn:
Well, you see, I came here to make the Temple's
White Day lively. That's definitely true!

MsgJp: よしっ！　これで――よしっ！
MsgEn: Alright! With this... alright!

MsgJp:
あらためて自分の姿を見てみると
――本当にこれでいいのか？
いや、いいはずだ！
最新のモードな俺であるはずだ！
MsgEn:
Upon taking a fresh look at my own appearance,
- Is this really okay?
No, it should be fine!
I should be the epitome of the latest fashion!

MsgJp:
色々と相談に乗ってくれて感謝するよッ！
君も恋に悩むことがあれば
今度は俺が相談に乗ろう！
MsgEn:
I'm grateful that you've been helping me with
various consultations!
If you ever have any troubles with love, I'll be
there to listen and offer advice next time!

MsgJp:
今の俺は魅力的だ、今の俺は魅力的だ――
うっ、すまない
ちょっと自己暗示をだね
MsgEn:
I am attractive now, I am attractive now -
Ah, sorry
Let me do a little self-suggestion

MsgJp: やあ、調子はどうだい
MsgEn: Hey, how are you feeling?

MsgJp: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ
MsgEn:
Today's existence is also thanks to The White
Dragon

MsgJp: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
MsgEn:
These enemies are multiplying, it's really
overwhelming.

MsgJp: ご機嫌いかが？
MsgEn: How are you?

MsgJp: 暮らしは厳しくなる一方だよ
MsgEn: Life keeps getting tougher

MsgJp: お仕事頑張って！
MsgEn: Good luck with your work!
